habit, custom; Lk 22:39, Jo 19:40, Ac 16:21 25:16, He 10:25; in Lk 1:9 Ac 6:14 15:1 21:21 26:3 28:17, almost in the narrower sense of law (Deiss., BS, 251 f.).†
to be accustomed, wont: Mt 27:15, Mk 10:1; ptcp., τὸ εἰθός, custom: κατὰ τὸ εἰ. (Nu, l.c.), Lk 4:16, Ac 17:2.†

Conditional, if; c. indic, expressing a general assumption; pres.: seq. indic, pres., Mt 11:14, Ro 8:25, al.; seq. imperat., Mk 4:23 9:22, Jo 15:18, I Co 7:9, al.; seq. fut. indic., Lk 16:31, Ro 8:11, al.; seq. pf. or aor., with negation in apodosis, Mt 12:26, Ro 4:14, al.; similarly, seq. impf., Lk 17:6, Jo 8:39; seq. quæst., Mt 6:23, Jo 5:47 7:23 8:46, I Pe 2:20; fut.: Mt 26:33, I Pe 2:20; pf.: Jo 11:12, Ro 6:5, al.; aor.: Lk 16:11 19:8, Jo 13:32, 18:23, Re 20:15, al. Where the assumption is certain = ἐπεί: Mt 12:28, Jo 7:4, Ro 5:17, al. Of an unfulfilled condition, c. indic, impf., aor. or plpf., seq. ἄν, c. imp. or aor. (v.s. ἄν, I, i). C. indic., after verbs denoting wonder, etc., sometimes, but not always, coupled with an element of doubt: Mk 15:44, I Jo 3:13, al. C. indic., as in LXX (Nu 14:3o, I Ki 14:45, al. = Heb. אִם), in oaths, with the formula of imprecation understood in a suppressed apodosis (WM, 627; Burton, §272): Mk 8:12, He 3:11 (LXX) 4:3 (LXX). Rarely (cl.) c. optat., to express a merely possible condition: Ac 24:19 27:39, I Co 14:10 15:37, I Pe3:14, 17. Interrogative, if, whether. As in cl., in indir. questions after verbs of seeing, asking, knowing, saying, etc.: c. indic. pres., Mt 26:63, Mk 15:36, Ac 19:2, II Co 13:5, al.; fut., Mk 3:2, Ac 8:22, al.; aor., Mk 15:44, I Co 1:16, al.; c. subjc. aor. (M, Pr., 194), Phl 3:12. As in LXX (= Heb. אִם and interrog. הֲ, Ge 17:17, al.; v. WM, 639f.; Viteau, i, 22), in direct questions: Mk 8:23 (Tr., WH, txt.), Lk 13:23, 22:49, Ac 19:2, al. With other particles. εἰ ἄρα, εἴγε, εἰ δὲ μήγε, v.s. ἄρα, γε. εἰ δὲ καί, but if also: Lk 11:18; but even if, I Co 4:7, II Co 4:3 11:16. εἰ δὲ μή, but if not, but if otherwise: Mk 2:21, 22 Jo 14:2, Re 2:5, al. εἰ καί, if even, if also, although: Mk 14:29, Lk 11:8, I Co 7:21, II Co 4:16, Phl 2:17, al. καὶ εἰ, even if, v.s. καί εἰ μή, if not, unless, except, but only: Mt 24:22, Mk 2:26 6:5, Jo 9:33, I Co 7:17 (only), Ga 1:19 (cf. ἐὰν μή, 2:16; v. Hort., Ja., xvi); ἐκτὸς εἰ μή, pleonastic (Bl., §65, 6), I Co 14:5 15:2, I Ti 5:19. εἰ μήν = cl. ἦ μήν (M, Pr., 46), in oaths, surely (Ez 33:27, al.): He 6:14. εἴ πως, if haply: Ac 27:12, Ro 1:10. εἴτε . . . εἴτε, whether . . . or; Ro 12:6-8, I Co 3:22 13:8, al.
appearance, look: Mt 28:3.†
that which is seen, appearance, external form: Lk 3:22 9:29, Jo 5:37, II Co 5:7 (ICC in l.). form, sort, kind: I Th 5:22.†
an idol's temple: I Co 8:10 (cf. Ἀσταρτεῖον, I Ki 31:10; v. ICC, in I Co, l.c.).†
sacrificed to idols: τὸ, τὰ εἰ, Ac 15:29 21:25, I Co 8:1, 4 7, 10 10:19, Re 2:14, 2o.†
idolatry: I Co 10:14, Ga 5:20, Col 3:5; pl. (Bl, §32, 6), I Pe 4:3 (Cremer, 390).†
an idolator: I Co 5:10, 11 6:9 10:7 Eph 5:5 Re 21:8 22:15 (Cremer, 709).†

in cl. a phantom, image, likeness; an image in the mind, an idea, fancy. In LXX and NT, an image of a god, an idol (cf. Polyb., xxxi, 3, 13): Ac 7:41, I Co 12:2, Re 9:20; the false god or idol worshipped in an image (ICC, on I Th, l.c.): Ac 15:20, Ro 2:22, I Co 8:4, 7 10:19 II Co 6:18, I Th 1:9, I Jo 5:21.†
without cause or reason: Mt 5:22 (E, mg.), Col 2:18 (ICC). vainly, fruitlessly, to no purpose: Ro 13:4, I Co 15:2, Ga 3:4 4:11, Col 2:18.†
to yield: Ga 2:5 (cf. ὑπ-είκω).†

an image, likeness: Mt 22:20, Mk 12:16, Lk 20:24, Ro 1:23, I Co 15:49, Re 13:14, 15 14:9, 11 15:2 16:2 19:20 20:4; opp. to σκιά, He 10:1; of man, εἰ. θεοῦ, 1 Co 11:7; of the regenerate, εἰ. τ. θεοῦ Col 3:10 (v. Lft., in l.); εἰ. τ. υἱοῦ τ. θεοῦ, Ro 8:29, II Co 3:18; of Christ, εἰ. τ. θεοῦ, II Co 4:4, Col 1:15.† SYN.: ὁμοίωμα, denoting resemblance, which may however be merely accidental. εἰ. is a derived likeness and like the head on a coin or the parental likeness in a child, implies an archetype. Cf. also εἶδος, appearance, not necessarily based on reality; σκιά, a shadowed resemblance; χαρακτήρ, the impress of a stamp; μόρφη (q.v.), the form as indicative of the inner being.
sincerity, purity: I Co 5:8, II Co 1:12 2:17.†
unalloyed, pure (Lat. sincerus; v. DCG, ii, 635a); of unmixed substances; of abstract ideas; of ethical purity: Phl 1:10, II Pe 3:1.†
sincerity, purity: I Co 5:8, II Co 1:12 2:17.†

with various uses and significations, like the English verb to be. As substantive verb. Of persons and things, to be, exist: Ac 17:28, Jo 1:1, 8:58, 17:5, al; ὁ ὢν καὶ ὁ ἦν (for past ptcp.), Re 1:4, 8, 4:8, 11:17, 16:5 (v. Swete, Ap., 5; M, Pr., 228); τὰ (μὴ) ὄντα, Ro 4:17, I Co 1:28. Of times, events, etc., to be, happen, take place: Mt 24:3, Mk 14:2, 15:42, Lk 21:23, Jo 4:6, 23, 5:10, al. to be present, be in a place, have come: Mt 2:13, 15, Mk 1:45, 5:21, 15:40, Lk 1:80, 5:29, Jo 7:30, al.; seq. εἰς, Mk 2:1; seq. ἐκ, (ἐξ), Mt 1:20, 21:25, Mk 11:30, Jo 3:31, al. Impers., ἔστι, ἦν, etc.; there is (Fr. il y a), was, etc.: Mt 16:28, Lk 16:19, Jo 3:1, 5:2, Ro 3:10, al.; c. dat. (of the possessor; Bl., §37, 3), Mt 16:22, Lk 1:7, Jo 18.10, Ro 9:2, al.; ἔστιν ὅς, ὅστις (chiefly in pl), Mt 16:28, 19:2, Mk 9:1, al.; c. inf., = ἔξεστιν (q.v.), it is possible: He 9:5, I Co 11:20, RV (but v. ICC, in l.). As copula uniting subject and predicate. Expressing simply identity or equivalence: Mt 5:13, 14:15, Lk 1:18, 19, Jo 1:1, 4:19, Re 3:9, al. mult. Explicative, as in parable, figure, type, etc.: Mt 13:19, I Co 9:2, 10:4, 11:25, Ga 4:24, Re 17:15, al.; ταῦτ’ ἔστιν, Mt 27:46, Mk 7:2, Ro 7:18 al.; ὅ ἐστιν, Mk 3:17, Col 1:24, He 7:2, al.; akin to this is the sacramental usage: Mt 26:26-28, Mk 14:22, 24, Lk 22:19, I Co 11:24 (v. ICC on Mk, I Co, ll. c.; DB, iii, 148 f.). C. gen.: qual., etc., Mk 5:42, Lk 3:23, I Co 14:33, He 12:11, al.; part., I Ti 1:20, II Ti 1:15; poss., Mt 5:3, 10, Mk 12:7, Lk 4:7; of service or partisanship, Ro 8:9, I Co 1:12, II Co 10:7, II Ti 2:19. C. dat. (BL, §37, 3): Ac 1:8, 9:15, Ro 4:12, I Co 1:18, 2:14, Re 21:7, al. C. ptcp., as a periphrasis for the simple verb (Bl., §62, 1, 2; M, Pr., 225 ff.); c. ptcp. pf. (cl.): Mt 10:30, Lk 9:32, Jo 3:24, Ac 21:35, I Co 15:19, al; c. ptcp. pr. (esp. in impf., as in Heb. and Aram.; Dalman, Words, 35 f.), Mt 7:29, Mk 1:22, Lk 4:31, 14:1, Ac 1:10, al. mult., id. for imper. (M, Pr., 180f., 182f.), with ellipsis of εἰμί, Ro 12:9, 10, He 13:5, al.; c. ptcp. aor. (cl), Lk 23:9. Seq. εἰς (cf. Heb. הָיָה לְ), a vernac. usage (M, Pr., 71): Mt 19:5, Mk 10:8, He 8:10, al. C. adv.: Mt 19:20, Mk 4:26, Lk 18:11, al. Ellipses; of the copula (Bl., §30, 3): Mt 8:29, 24:32, Jo 21:22, 23, He 6:4, al.; of the predicate: ἐγώ εἰμί, Mt 14:27, Mk 6:50, al.; absol. (cf. De 32:39; אֲנִי הוּא), Mk 13:6, Jo 4:26, al. (cf. ἄπ-, ἔν-, πάρ-, συμ-πάρ-, σύν-ειμι).
to bring to peace, reconcile (so I Mac 6:60). to keep peace, be at peace: Mk 9:50, Ro 12:18, II Co 13:11, I Th 5:13 (cf. Si 28:9; Cremer, 246).†

peace; of public peace, freedom from war: Lk 14:32, Ac 12:20 24:2; of the church, Ac 9:31. Of peace between persons, concord, agreement : Mt 10:34, Lk 12:51, Ro 14:17, I Co 7:15, Ga 5:22, Ja 3:18; ζητεῖν εἰ., I Pe 3:11; διώκειν, II Ti 2:22; ib. seq. μετὰ πάντων, He 12:14; by meton., of him who brings peace, Eph 2:14. As in LXX (= Heb. שָׁלוֹם , Aram. שְׁלָם), of a state of security and safety: Jo 16:33, Ro 2:10, I Th 5:3,́ whence the formulae, ὕπαγε (πορεύου) εἰς εἰ, Mk 5:34, Lk 7:50 (cf. I Ki 1:17, al.; לְכִי לְשָׁלוֹם); εἰ. ὑμῖν (שָׁלוֹם לָכֶם), Jo 20:19, 21, 26; ἀπολύειν ἐν εἰ., Lk 2:29, cf. I Co 16:11; ἡ εἰ. ὑμῶν, Mt 10:13, Lk 10:6; υἱὸς εἰρήνης, ib. Of spiritual peace, the peace of Christ's kingdom (DCG, ii, 330f.): Lk 1:79 2:14 Jo 16:33, Ro 2:10 5:1 8:6, al.; ὁ κύριος τῆς εἰ., II Th 3:16; ὁ θεὸς τῆς εἰ., Ro 15:33 16:20, II Co 13:11, al.; in epistolary salutations, Ro 1:7, I Co 1:3, Ga 1:3, I Th 1:1, I Pe 1:2, II Jo 3, Re 1:4, al. (v. Cremer, 244).
peaceful: He 12:11, Ja 3:17.†
to make peace: Col 1:20.†
peace-making, a peacemaker: Mt 5:9†

expressing entrance, direction, limit, into, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among (Lat. in, c. acc.). Of place. After verbs of motion; of entrance into: Mt 8:23, 9:7, Mk 1:45, Lk 2:15, 8:31, al.; of approach, to or towards: Mk 11:1, Lk 6:8, 19:28, Jo 11:31, 21:6, al.; before pl. and collective nouns, among: Mk 4:7, 8:19, 20, Lk 11:49, Jo 21:23, al.; Of a limit reached, unto, on, upon: Mt 8:18, 21:1, Mk 11:1, 13:16, Lk 14:10, Jo 6:3, 11:32, al.; c. acc. pers. (as in Ep. and Ion.), Ac 23:15, Ro 5:12, 16:19, II Co 10:14; elliptical: ἐπιστολαὶ εἰς Δαμασκόν, Ac 9:2; ἡ διακονία μου ἡ εἰς Ἱ., Ro 15:31; metaph., of entrance into a certain state or condition, or of approach or direction towards some end (Thayer, B, i, 1; ii, 1), εἰς τ. ὄνομα, M, Pr., 200. Of direction; after verbs of seeing: Mt 6:26, Mk 6:41, Lk 9:16, 62, Jo 13:22, al.; metaph., of the mind, He 11:26, 12:2, al.; after verbs of speaking: Mt 13:10, 14:9, I Th 2:9, al. After verbs of rest; in "pregnant" construction, implying previous motion (cl.; v. WM, 516; Bl., §39, 3; M, Pr., 234f.): Mt 2:23, 4:13, II Th 2:4, II Ti 1:11, He 11:9, al.; by an assimilation general in late Gk (v. Bl., M, Pr., ll. c.) = ἐν: Lk 1:44, 4:23, Ac 20:16, 21:17, Jo 1:18 (but v. Westc, in l.), al. Of time, for, unto; accentuating the duration expressed by the acc.: εἰς τ. αἰῶνα, Mt 21:19; εἰς γενεὰς καὶ γ., Lk 1:50; εἰς τ. διηνεκές, He 7:3, al. Of a point or limit of time, unto, up to, until: Mt 6:34, Ac 4:3, 25:21, Phl 1:10, 2:16, I Th 4:15, II Ti 1:12; of entrance into a future period, σεις τὸ μέλλον (v.s. μέλλω), next (year), Lk 13:9 (but c. ICC, in l.); εἰς τ. μεταξὺ σάββατον, on the next Sabbath, Ac 13:42; εἰς τὸ πάλιν (v.s. πάλιν, II Co 13:2. Of result, after verbs of changing, joining, dividing, etc.: στρέφειν εἰς, Re 11:6; μετας-, Ac 2:20, Ja 4:9; μεταλλάσσειν, Ro 1:26; σχίζειν εἰς δύο, Mt 27:51, al.; predicatively with εἴναι, Ac 8:23. Of relation, to, towards, for, in regard to (so in cl., but more freq. in late Gk., εἰς encroaching on the simple dat., which it has wholly displaced in MGr.; Jannaris, Gr., §1541; Robertson, Gr., 594; Deiss., BS, 117f.): Lk 7:30, Ro 4:20, 15:2, 26, I Co 16:1, Eph 3:16, al.; ἀγάπη εἰς, Ro 5:8, al.; χρηστός, Eph 4:32; φρονεῖν εἰς, Ro 12:16; θαρρεῖν, II Co 10:1. Of the end or object: εὔθετος εἰς, Lk 14:34; σόφος, Ro 16:19; ἰσχύειν, Mt 5:13; εἰς τοῦτο, Mk 1:38, al.; ἀφορίζειν εἰς, Ro 1:1; indicating purpose, εἰς φόβον, Ro 8:15; εἰς ἔνδειξιν, Ro 3:25; εἰς τό, c. inf. (= ἵνα or ὥστε; Bl., §71, 5; M, Pr., 218ff.): Mt 20:19, Ro 1:11, I Co 9:18, al. Adverbial phrases: εἰς τέλος, εἰς τὸ πάλιν, etc (v.s. τέλος, πάλιν, etc.).

ιά, ἕν, gen. ἑνός, μιᾶς, ἑνός,; cardinal numeral, one; one, as opp. to many: Mt 25:15, Ro 5:12, I Co 10:8, al.; as subst., Ro 5:15, Eph 2:14; id. c. gen. partit., Mt 5:19, al.; seq. ἐκ (ἐξ), Mk 14:18, Jo 6:8, al.; metaph., of union and concord, Jo 10:30 17:11, Ro 12:4-5, Phl 1:27; ἀπὸ μιᾶς (B1., § 44, 1), Lk 14:18; c. neg., εἷς. . . οὐ (μή), more emphatic than οὐδείς, no one, none (cl.), Mt 5:18 10:29, Lk 11:46 12:6.; Emphati­cally, to the exclusion of others; a single (one): Mt 21:24, Mk 8:14; absol., I Co 9:24, al.; οὐδὲ εἷς, Mt 27:14, Jo 1:3, Ro 3:10, al.; one, alone: Mk 2:7 10:18, Lk 18:19; one and the same: Ro 3:30, I Co 3:8 11:5 12:11, I Jn 5:8.; In late Gk., with weakened force, = τις or indef. art. (of. Heb. אֶחָד, Ge 22:13, al.; v. B1., § 45, 2; M, Pr., 96 f.): Mt 8:19 19:6, Re 8:13, al.; εἷς τις (Bl., l.c.), Lk 22:50, Jo 11:49; Distributively: εἷς καστος (cl.), Lk 4:40, Ac 2:6, al.; εἷς . . . καὶ εἷς (cl., εἷς μὲν . . . εἷς δέ), Mt 17:4, Mk 9:5, Jo 20:12, al. (cf. LXX and use of Heb. אֶחָד, Ex 17:12, al); ὁ εἷς . . . ὁ ἕτερος (ἄλλος) = cl. ὁ μὲν (ἕτερος) . . . ὁ δέ (ἕτερος), Mt 6:24, Lk 7:41, Re 17:10; καθ' εἷς, εἷς κ. είς (in which καθ' is adverbial, or the expression formed from the analogy of ἕν καθ' ἔν; M, Pr., 105), one by one, severally: Mk 14:19, Ro 12:5, al.; εἷς τὸν ἕνα = ἀλλήλους (B1., 45, 2; M, Pr., 246), I Th 5:11.; As ordinal = πρῶτος (like Heb. אֶחָד; Bl., § 45, 1; M, Pr., 95 f.), first: Mt 28:1, Mk 16:2, al

to listen to, in two senses; to obey: I Co 14:21 (cf. De 1:43, Si 3:6); to listen, assent to; pass., to be heard: of persons praying, Mt 6:7, He 5:7; of the prayer offered, Lk 1:13, Ac 10:31 (cf. Ps 4:2, Si 34:26); v. Cremer, 624).†
to admit, receive: II Co 6:17 (LXX) (Cremer, 687).†
to go in, enter: seq. εἰς, Ac 3:3 21:26, He 9:6; πρὸς Ἰάκωβον, Ac 21:18.†

to go in or into, enter: Mt 9:25, Lk 7:45, al.; seq. εἰς, Mt 10:12, Mk 2:1, al.; seq. διά (πύλης, θύρας, etc.), Mt 7:13, Jo 10:1, al.; ὑπὸ τ. στέγην, Mt 8:8; c. adv.: ὅπου, Mk 14:14, He 6:20; ὧδε, Mt 22:12; ἔσω, Mt 26:58; seq. πρός, c acc. pers., Mk 15:43, Lk 1:28, Ac 10:3 11:3 16:40 17:2 28:8, Re 3:20; of demons taking possession, Mk 9:25, Lk 8:30 22:3, Jo 13:27; of food, Mt 15:11, Ac 11:8. Metaph., of thoughts, Lk 9:46; εἰς κόπον, Jo 4:38; εἰς πειρασμόν, Mt 26:41, Lk 22:40, 46; of hope as an anchor, He 6:19; βοαί, Ja 5:4; πνεῦμα ζωῆς, Re 11:11; εἰς τ. κόσμον (cf. Wi 2:24 14:14, Jo 18:37), Ro 5:12, He 10:5; in counterparts of Jewish Aram. phrases relating to the theocracy (cf. Dalman, Words, 116ff.): εἰς τ. γάμους, Mt 25:10; εἰς τ. χάραν τ. κυρίου, Mt 25:21, 23; εἰς τ. ζωήν, Mt 18:8, 9 19:17, Mk 9:43, 45; εἰς τ. βασιλ. τ. οὐρανῶν, Mt 5:20 7:21, al. (v.s. βασιλεία); εἰς τ. κατάπαυσιν, He 3:11, 18 4:1ff.; εἰς τ. δόξαν, Lk 24:26; εἰσ. καὶ ἐξερχ., to go in and out (like Heb. בֹוא וְצֵאת, De 28:6, etc.), of familiar intercourse, Ac 1:21; fig., of moral freedom, Jo 10:9 (cf. ἐπ-, παρ-, συν-εισέρχομαι).
to call in: mid., c. acc pers., Ac 10:23.†

a means of entering, place of entrance: He 10:19, II Pe 1:11 (cf. Westc., He., l.c.; MM, Exp., xii; but v. infr.).; a going in, entrance: Ac 13:24; c. gen. loc., He 10:19 (Thayer, s.v.; but v. supr.); seq. εἰς, II Pe 1:11 (Mayor, in l.; Thayer; but v. supr.); πρός, II Th 1:9 2:1.†
to spring in, rush in: Ac 14:14 (Rec.), Ac 16:29 (for exx. from π., v. MM, Exp., xii).†
to spring forth: εἰς τ. ὄχλον (cf. Ju 14:17), Ac 14:14 (for ex. in π., v. MM, Exp., xii).†

to go into, enter: Lk 8:16 11:33 19:30; seq. εἰς, Mk 1:21 6:56 11:2, Lk 22:10, Ac 3:2; πρός, c. acc pers., Ac 28:30; ὅπου, Mk 5:40; κατά τ. οἴκους, house after house, Ac 8:3; of things (food), Mt 15:17, Mk 7:15, 18-19 Metaph. (cf. εἰοέρχομαι, 2), Mk 4:19, Lk 18:24; εἰσ. καὶ ἐκπορ., to associate with, seq. μετά (cf. εἰσέρχομαι), Ac 9:28.†
to run in: Ac 12:14.†
to bring in, into: c. acc pers., Lk 5:18-19; seq. εἰς, Mt 6:13, Lk 11:4; ἐπί, Lk 12:11; c. acc rei, seq. εἰς, I Ti 6:7; pass., He 13:11.†

denoting sequence; of time; then, next: Mk 8:25, Lk 8:12, Jo 13:5 19:27 20:27, I Ti 3:10, Ja 1:15; seq. gen. abs., Mk 4:17; in enumerations, I Co 15:5 15:7 15:24, I Ti 2:13.; In argument; therefore, then,; furthermore: He 12:9 (cf. εἶτεν).†
Ion. and Hellenistic for εἶτα (q.v.), then: Mk 4:28.†

from out of, from (see Addendum, p. 492).; of motion outwards, separation from (opp. to εἰς; = Lat. e, ex), from out of, from among, from. Of Place, of motion, out of, forth from, off from: Jo 6:31, Ac 9:3, Ga 1:8, al.; esp. after verbs of motion, Mt 8:28 17:9, Mk 1:25 7:28, Jo 1:33 20:1, Ac 12:7, 17 27:30, al.; constr. praeg., σώζειν (διας) ἐκ, Ju 5, Ac 28:4. Metaph., Mt 7:4, 5, I Pe 2:9; ἐκ τ. χειρός (-ῶν), seq. gen. pers., Lk 1:74, Jo 10:28, 29, 39, Ac 12:4 24:7, Re 19:2; πίνειν (q.v.) ἐκ; of the place from which an action proceeds, Lk 5:3 (cf. 12:36, Jo 13:4, II Co 2:4). Of change from one place or condition to another: Jo 8:42, Ro 6:13 13:11, Re 7:14, al.; c. ellips. of verb of motion, II Ti 2:26, II Pe 2:21, Re 2:21, al. Of separation or distinction from a number, before collective or pl. nouns: Mt 13:47, 49, Jo 12:1, Ac 3:15, I Pe 1:3, al.; after εἷς, Mt 10:29 Lk 17:15, al.; οὐδείς, Jo 7:19, al.; πολλοί, Jo 11:19, al.; τις, Lk 11:15, al.; τίς, Mt 6:27, al.; in partitive phrase as subject of sentence, Jo 16:17; Hebraistically, ἐκ μέσου seq. gen., = ἐκ (Heb. מִתֹּוךְ), Mt 13:49, al. Of position or direction (so in cl. = ἔξω): ἐκ δεξιῶν (v.s. δεξιός); ἐξ ἐναντίας, Mk 15:39 (metaph., Tit 2:8); ἐκ ῥιζῶν (i.e., utterly), Mt 11:20. Of Time, of the point of time from which, from, since: ἐκ γενετῆς, Jo 9:1, cf. Mk 10:20, Lk 23:8, Ac 24:10, al. Of succession in time: ἐκ δευτέρου, a second time, Mk 14:72, al., cf. Mt 26:44; ἡμέραν ἐξ ἡμέρας, from day to day, II Pe 2:8. Of Origin, of nativity, lineage, race: κοίτην (ἐν γαστρί) ἔχειν, Ro 9:10, Mt 1:18; γεννᾶν ἐκ, Mt 1:3ff.; γεννᾶσθαι (γίνεσθαι) ἐκ, Jo 3:6 8:41, Ga 4:4; ἐκ πνεύματος (θεοῦ), Jo 1:13 3:5ff., al. ἔρχεσθαι, εἶναι, etc., ἐκ τ. πολέως, Jo 1:44; φυλῆς, Lk 2:36, al.; τ. ἐξουσίας Ἡρῴδου, Lk 23:7; ὁ ὢν ἐκ τ. γῆς, Jo 3:31. Of the author, occasion or source: Mt 5:37, Jo 2:16, Ro 2:29, I Co 8:6, Ga 5:8, al.; ἐκ (τ. θεοῦ, I Co 7:7, II Co 5:1, I Jo 4:7; ἐκ τ. πατρός, Jo 6:65, al.; ἐκ τ. γῆς ἐστιν, λαλεῖ, Jo 3:31; εκ καρδίας, Ro 6:17, cf. Mk 12:30, I Ti 1:5; ἐκ ψυχῆς, Eph 6:6, Col 3:23; ἐκ πίστεως, Ro 14:23; κρίνειν ἐκ, Lk 19:22, Re 20:12. Of the agent, after passive verbs: Mt 15:5, Mk 7:11, II Co 2:2, al.; freq. in Re after αδικεῖσθαι (2:11), etc. Of cause, dependence, source of supply: τ. πόνου (των), Re 16:10, 11; τ. φωνῶν, Re 8:13; ἐκ τούτου, Jo 6:66 19:12 (but v. Meyer, in ll.); ἐκ θεοῦ λαλεῖν, II Co 2:17; ἐκ τ. ἀληθείας, Jo 18:37, I Jo 3:19; ὁ ἐκ πίστεως, Ro 3:26 4:16; οἱ (ὄντες) ἐκ περιτομῆς, Ac 11:2, Ro 4:12, Ga 2:12, Col 4:11; πίνειν ἐκ, Mt 26:29, Mk 14:25, Jo 4:13, al.; θερίζειν, Ga 6:8; μετέχειν ἐκ (= partit. gen.), I Co 10:13; c. inf., ἐκ τοῦ ἔχειν, II Co 8:11. Of material: Mt 27:29, Jo 2:15 19:2, Ro 9:21, I Co 11:12, Re 18:12, al.; allied to which is its use of price (= cl. gen.): Mt 27:7, cf. ib. 20:2, Ac 1:18. By attraction = ἐν (cl.): τὰ ἐκ τ. οἰκιας, Mt 24:17; τ. ἐξ αὐτοῦ δύναμιν, Mk 5:30 (v. Field, in l.); ὁ πατὴρ ὁ ἐξ οὐρανοῦ, Lk 11:13. Adverbial phrases: ἐξ ἀνάγκης, II Co 9:7, He 7:12; ἐξ ἰσότητος, II Co 8:13; ἐκ μέρους, I Co 12:27 13:9-12; ἐκ μέτρου, Jo 3:34; ἐκ συμφώνου, I Co 7:5. in composition, ἐκ signifies, procession, removal: ἐκβαίνω, ἐκβάλλω. Opening out, unfolding: ἐκτείνω; metaph., ἐξαγγάλλω. Origin: ἔκγονος. Completeness: ἐξαπορέω (v. M, Pr., 237), ἐκπληρόω, ἐκτελέω.
each time, always: II Pe 1:15.†
indecl.,; a hundred: Mt 13:8, 23 Lk 15:4, al.; κατὰ ἑ, Mk 6:40; εἰς, ἐν ἑ., Mk 4:8, 20
a hundred years old: Ro 4:19.†

to drive, cast or send out, to expel: c. acc rei, mid. (σῖτον), seq. εἰς, Ac 27:38; pass., Mt 15:17; c. acc pers., Mt 21:12, Mk 11:15, al.; δαιμόνια, Mt 7:22, Mk 1:34, al.; id. seq. ἐκ, Mk 7:26; παρά, Mk 16:9; ἐν, Mk 3:22; (ἐν) τ. ὀνόματι, Mt 7:22, Mk 9:38; λόγῳ, Mt 8:16; seq. ἔξω, Jo 6:37; id. c. gen., Mk 12:8, al.; of expulsion from home, Ga 4:30; from the Church, III Jn 10.; In LXX and NT (like Heb. יָצָא and Aram. הַנְפֵּק), to command or cause to depart: Mt 9:38, Mk 1:12 (v. Swete, in l.), ib. Mk 1:43 5:40, Lk 10:2, Ja 2:25; τ. κρίσιν εἰς νῖκος (to cause to proceed to its goal), Mt 12:20 (LXX).; to reject (cl.): τ. ὄνομα ὑμῶς ὡς πονηρόν (cf. De 25:14), Lk 6:22; to leave out, Re 11:2.; to take, draw or pluck out; with violence: Mt 7:5, Mk 9:47, Lk 6:42; to bring forth or out of: Mt 12:35, Lk 10:35.
a way out (Hom., Xen.): I Co 10:13.; the issue (Menand.) He 13:7.†
to go out: He 11:15.†
a throwing out.; a jettison, a throwing overboard of cargo: Ac 27:18 (cf. Jos, l.c.; and v. Field, Notes, 144 f.).†
Rec. for γαμίζω, q.v.: Mt 22:30 24:38, Lk 17:27, I Co 7:38. Not elsewhere.†
Rec. for γαμίσκω, q.v.: Lk 20:34-35. Not elsewhere.†
c. gen., born of.; As subst., ὁ, ἡ ἔ., a child, son or daughter; in pl., descendants: τέκνα ἢ ἔ., children or grand-children, I Ti 5:4.†
strengthened form of δαπανάω, to spend wholly; pass., with reflexive force, to spend oneself wholly: seq. ὑπέρ, II Co 12:15.†
to take or receive from (Hom., Hdt., a1.).; (Rare in cl.), to expect, await: c. acc rei, Jo 5:3, He 11:10, Ja 5:7; c. acc pers., Ac 17:16, I Co 11:33 16:11; seq. ἕως, He 10:13 (Cremer, 687).†
strengthened form of δῆλος, q.v., quite clear, evident: II Ti 3:9.†
to be from home, absent: II Co 5:6; seq. ἀπό, II Co 5:8; seq. ἐκ, II Co 5:9 (cf. ἀπο-, ἐνδημέω).†
to surrender, give up, give out.; to let out for hire (Hdt.); mid. (as freq. in π.; v. MM, Exp., xii); to let out to one's advantage, Mt 21:33, 41, Mk 12:1, Lk 20:9.†
to tell in detail, relate, declare: Ac 13:41 (LXX) Ac 15:3.†

to vindicate: c. acc pers., Lk 18:3, 5.; to avenge: c. acc pers., ἑαυτούς, Ro 12:19; c. acc rei, παρακοήν, II Co 10:6; αἷμα, Re 6:10 19:2 (Cremer, 203; for exx. from π. in both senses, v. MM, Exp., xii).†

vengeance, vindication: Lk 21:22, Ro 12:19 (v. MM, Exp., xii), He 10:30 (LXX), II Co 7:11; of the injured person, c. gen., Lk 18:7-8; c. dat., Ac 7:24; of the offender, c. gen. obj., I Pe 2:14; c. dat., II Th 1:8 (cf. Si 12:6).†
without law, unjust.; exacting penalty from; as subst., an avenger: Ro 13:4; seq. περί, I Th 4:6 (in π., a legal representative; Milligan, Th., l.c.).†
to chase away, drive out: I Th 2:15 (cf. De 6:19, Jl 2:20).†
given up, delivered over: Ac 2:23 (for construction, v. Field, Notes, 111 f.).†
in cl.,; a receiving from, succession; an interpretation.; In NT, = προσδοκία, expectation: He 10:27 (cf. Field, Notes, 231; Cremer, 688).†
to take of, strip of, strip: c. acc pers. (sc. clothing), Mt 27:28; c. acc pers. et rei, Mt 27:31, Mk 15:20, Lk 10:30; mid., to put off: fig., of the body, II Co 5:4.†

properly, of place, there: Mt 2:13 5:24, al.; οἱ ἐ., Mt 26:71; οὗ . . . ἐ., Mt 6:21 18:20 24:28, Mk 6:10, Lk 12:34; pleonastic, ὅπου . . . ἐ. (= שָׁם אֲשֶׁר, De 4:5, al.), Re 12:6, 14 (cf. Bl., § 50, 4).; As often in cl. (Hdt., Thuc., al.), with verbs of motion, for ἐκεῖσε, thither: Mt 2:22 17:20 24:28 26:36, Mk 6:33, Lk 12:18 17:37 21:2, Jo 11:8 18:2-3, Ro 15:24
of place, thence: Mt 4:21, Mk 6:1, al.; Of time, thereafter (v.s. κἀκεῖθεν).

that person or thing (ille), implying remoteness as compared with οὗτος (hic); absol., emphatic he, she, it: opp. to οὗτος, Lk 18:14, Ja 4:15; ἡμεῖς, He 12:25; ὑμεῖς, Mk 4:11; ἄλλοι, Jo 9:9; ἐγώ, Jo 3:30; to persons named, Mk 16:[10, 13, 20], Jo 2:21; of one (absent) who is not named, contemptuously (Abbott, JG, §§2385, 2732), Jo 7:11 9:28; with respect, of Christ, I Jo 2:6 3:3, al.; referring to a preceding noun, Mk 16:[10], Jo 7:45; resumption of a participial subject, Jo 1:33 9:37 10:1, Ro 14:14, al. (on its reference in Jo 19:35, v. Westc, in l.; Moffatt, Intr., 568; Sanday, Fourth Gospel, 77ff.). As adj., joined, like οὗτος, to a noun with the article: Mt 7:25, Mk 3:24, Jo 18:15, al.; esp. of time, past or future: ἐν τ. ἡμέραις ἐ., Mt 3:1, Mk 1:9, Ac 2:18 (LXX), al.; ἐν ἐ. τ. ἡμέρᾳ, esp of the Parousia, Mt 7:22, Lk 6:23, II Th 1:10, II Ti 1:12; adverbially, ἐκεινής (sc. ὁδοῦ) = cl. ἐκεινῇ (Bl., §36, 13), that way, Lk 19:4.
thither: Ac 21:3; constr. pregn. (MM, Exp., xii; Field, Notes, 134), τοὺς ἐ. ὄντας, Ac 22:5.†

to seek out or after, search for: c. acc pers. (I Mac 9:26); fig., τ. κύριον, θεόν (cf. Ps 14:2, Am 5:4, al.), Ac 15:17, Ro 3:11, He 11:6; εὐλογίαν, He 12:17; ἐξεζήτησαν κ. ἐξηραύνησαν (as in I Mac 9:26), sought and searched out: I Pe 1:10.; As in II Ki 4:11, Ez 3:18, 20 al. (דָּרַשׁ), to demand, require: Lk 11:50-51 †
a questioning (RV), subject for dispute: I Ti 1:4.†
to be amazed.; to amaze, terrify (Si 30:9). Pass., to be amazed, terrified: Mk 9:15 14:33 16:5-6.†
amazed (cf. Polyb., xx, 10, 9): Ac 3:11.†
strengthened form of θαυμ-; to wonder greatly: Mk 12:17.†
cast out: ποιεῖν ἔ. = ἐκτιθέναι, Ac 7:19.†
to cleanse thoroughly, cleanse out: c. acc, ἑαυτόν, II Ti 2:21; of the impurity removed, ζυμήν, I Co 5:7.†
to burn up.; to kindle. Pass., to burn: metaph., of the passions (cf. Si 16:6, Jb 3:17), Ro 1:27.†
to prick out, put out (Arist.).; to pierce (Polyb., LXX): c. acc pers., Jo 19:37 (LXX), Re 1:7.†
to break off: pass., Ro 11:17-20.†
to shut out: Ga 4:17. Pass., Ro 3:27.†

prop., an assembly of citizens regularly convened (in Thuc., ii, 22, opp. to σύλλογος, a concourse): Ac 19:32, 39 41. In LXX of the assembly, congregation, community of Israel (De 4:10 23:2, al.): Ac 7:38, He 2:12 (LXX). NT, esp. of an assembly or company of Christians, a (the) church; of gatherings for worship: I Co 11:18 14:19, 34 35; of local communities: Ac 8:3, I Co 4:17; with name added, Ac 8:1, Ro 16:1, I Th 1:1, al.; pl., Ac 15:41, I Co 7:17; τ. Χριστοῦ, Ro 16:16; τ. Ἀσίας, I Co 16:19; τ. ἁγίων, I Co 14:33; εἰπο]ν τ. ἐκκλησίᾳ, Mt 18:17 (but v. Hort, Ecclesia, 10); of a house-congregation (DB, i, 431a), Ro 16:5, I Co 16:19, Col 4:15, Phm 2; of the whole body of Christians: Mt 16:18, I Co 12:28, Eph 1:22, Phl 3:6, al.; τ. θεοῦ, Ac 20:28 (Κυρίου, T, R, mg.), I Co 15:9, Ga 1:13, I Ti 3:15; ἐ. προτοτόκων ἀπογεγραμμένων ἐν οὐρανοῖς, He 12:23.
intrans., to turn aside, turn away: metaph., from the right path, absol., Ro 3:12 (LXX); from evil, absol., I Pe 3:11; seq. ἀπό, c. gen. pers., Ro 16:17.†
to swim out of: Ac 27:42.†
to carry out: as freq., a corpse for burial, Lk 7:12.†
in T for ἐνκοπή (q.v.): I Co 9:12.†

to cut out, cut off, cut down: of a hand, foot, Mt 5:30 18:8; a tree, Mt 3:10 7:19 Lk 3:9 13:7, 9; fig., of a branch, Ro 11:22; seq. ἐκ, Ro 11:24; metaph., τ. ἀφορμήν (cf. Jb 19:10 ἐλπίδα), II Co 11:12.†
Lk 19:48 (WH, v.s. ἐκκρέμαννυμι).†
to hang from or upon; mid., ἐκκρέμαμαι: fig., ἐξεκρέματο αὐτοῦ άκούων (Rec.; WH read ἐξεκρέμετο, which implies a Pres. ἐκκρέμομαι, otherwise unknown; cf. Veitch, s.v. κρέμαμαι), Lk 19:48.†
to speak out, divulge: Ac 23:22.†
to shine forth: Mt 13:43.†
to escape notice utterly; mid., to forget utterly: He 12:5.†

to pick out, choose. In NT always mid. (exc. Lk 9:35, ἐκλελεγμένος, WH, ἀγαπητός, R, mg.), to pick out for oneself, choose (cf. M, Pr., 157 f.): c. acc rei, Lk 10:42 14:7; c. acc pers., Ac 6:5 15:22, 25; of Christ (v. supr.), Lk 9:35; of Christ's choice of disciples, Lk 6:13, Jo 6:70 13:18 15:16, 19 Ac 1:2; of the Divine choice: of persons, Mk 13:20, Ac 1:24 13:17 15:7, Eph 1:4, Ja 2:5; of things, I Co 1:27-28 (Cremer, 402, 773).†
trans., to leave out, pass over.; Intrans., to leave off, cease, fail: μαμωνᾶς, Lk 16:9; πίστις, Lk 22:32; ἔτη, He 1:12 (LXX); of the sun in an eclipse, Lk 23:45.†

choice, select (cl., rarely; Thuc., Plat., al.), hence, eminent: Ro 16:13 (cf. Ez 27:24).; As in Inscr. (MM, Exp., xii), chosen; esp. as in LXX, of Israel, elect, chosen of God (Is 65:9, Ps 105:43, al.); so in NT; of Christ: Lk 23:35 (cf. Is 42:1); fig., λίθος, I Pe 2:4-6 (LXX); of holy angels: I Ti 5:21; of Christians: Mt 24:22, 24, Mk 13:20, 22 13:27, II Ti 2:10, I Pe 1:1; τ. θεοῦ, Lk 18:7, Ro 8:33, Col 3:12, Tit 1:1; τ. Χριστοῦ, Mt 24:31; ἐ. κυρία, II Jn 1; ἀδελφή, II Jn 13; γένος, I Pe 2:9 (LXX); κλητοὶ καὶ ἐ. κ. πιστοί, Re 17:14; opp. to κλητός (not so in Epp.; v. Lft. on Col 3:12), Mt 20:16 (T, WH, txt., R, omit) Mt 22:14 (Cremer, 405, 775).†

a choice, selection; in NT, always of the Divine choice (EV, election): σκεῦος ἐκλογῆς, gen. qual., a chosen vessel; κατ ἐ., Ro 9:11 11:5, 28; c. gen. pers., I Th 1:4, II Pe 1:10; by meton., ἡ ἐ. = οἱ ἐκλεκτοί, Ro 11:7.†
to loose, release.; to unloose, as a bow-string, to relax, enfeeble; pass., to be faint, grow weary: Mt 15:32, Mk 8:3; of mental weariness, Ga 6:9, He 12:3, 5 (LXX).†
to wipe off: c. acc, Lk 7:38, 44, Jo 11:2 12:3 13:5.†
to hold up the nose in derision at, scoff at: c. acc, Lk 16:14 23:35.†
to bend the head aside (Xen.).; to shun, avoid (Diod.); to withdraw: Jo 5:13†
to become sober after drunkenness: metaph., of sobriety of mind, I Co 15:34.†
usually of actions, voluntary: κατὰ ἑ., of free will (Lft., in l), Phm 14.†
voluntarily, willingly: He 10:26, I Pe 5:2.†
for a long time, from of old: II Pe 2:3 3:5.†
= cl. ἐκπειράομαι,; to put to the proof or test, make trial of, tempt: c. acc, of God, Mt 4:7 (LXX), Lk 4:12 (ib.), I Co 10:9; of Christ, Lk 10:25 (Cremer, 497).†
to send forth: Ac 13:4 17:10.†
more exceedingly: Mk 14:31 (of. ὑπερπερ-).†
to spread out (as a sail), stretch forth: Ro 10:21(LXX).†

to fall out of, fall from, fall off: seq. ἐκ τ. χειρῶν, Ac 12:7; absol., Ac 27:32; of the withering of flowers (as LXX, ll c.), Ja 1:11, I Pe 1:24 (LXX); of navigators falling off from a straight course, Ac 27:17, 26 27:29 Metaph., c. gen. rei: Ga 5:4, II Pe 3:17; absol., fall from its place, fail, perish: Ro 9:6.†
to sail away: Ac 20:6; seq. εἰς, Ac 15:39 18:18.†
to fill full, make up a number.; to fulfil (MM, Exp., xii; Cremer, 839), Ac 13:32.†
a completion, fulfilment: Ac 21:26.†

prop., to strike out, drive away.; to strike with panic or shock, to amaze, astonish: pass., Mt 13:54 19:25, Mk 6:2 7:37 10:26, Lk 2:48; seq. ἐπί, c. dat. rei, Mt 7:28 22:33, Mk 1:22 11:18, Lk 4:32 9:43, Ac 13:12.†; τρεμεῖν, to tremble, predominantly physical; φοβεῖν, to fear, "the general term," Thayer; cf. also φρίσσω, to shudder, and v.s. δειλία
to breathe out; sc. βίον, ψυχήν (expressed in cl., Æsch., al.; cf. LS, s.v.), to breathe one's last, expire: Mk 15:37, 39 Lk 23:46. For force of aorist, v. Swete, Mk 15:37.†

to make to go out; pass. and mid., to go forth: Lk 3:7, Ac 25:4; of demons leaving one possessed, Mt 17:21 (WH om.), Ac 19:12; of excrement, Mk 719; seq. ἀπό, Mt 20:29, Mk 10:46; ἐκ, Mk 13:1 (of the dead rising, Jo 5:29); ἐκεῖθεν, Mk 6:11; ἔξω, Mk 11:19; είς, Mk 10:17, Jo 5:29; ἐπί, c. acc pers., Re 16:14; πρός, c. acc pers., Mt 3:5, Mk 1:5; εἰσπορ- (q.v.) καὶ ἐ., Ac 9:28; metaph., to come forth, proceed: of feelings, etc., Mk 7:23; seq. ἐκ, Mt 15:11, 18 Mk 7:15, 20-21, Lk 4:22, Eph 4:29; ῥῆμα, seq. διά, Mt 4:4 (LXX); of lightning and flame, Re 4:5 9:17-18 11:5; a river, Re 22:1; a sword, Re 1:16 19:15; a rumour, seq. εἰς, Lk 4:37; of the Holy Spirit, seq. παρά, Jo 15:26.†
strengthened form of πoρνεύω, implying excessive indulgence; mid, to give oneself up to fornication: Ju 7.†
to spit out.; to spit at in disgust, to abominate, loathe (= cl. ἀποπτ-, καταπτ-): Ga 4:14.†
to root out, pluck up by the roots: c. acc rei, Mt 13:29 15:13 Lk 17:6, Ju 12.†

a displacement (Arist.).; An abnormal condition of the mind, in which the subject passes out of his usual self-control (Hippocr.); in NT (Kennedy, Sources, 121 f.); a trance: Ac 10:10 11:5 22:17; amazement: Mk 5:42 16:8, Lk 5:26, Ac 3:19.†
to turn out of (Hom.).; to turn inside out; metaph., to change entirely, pervert (Aristoph.): Tit 3:11.†
to throw into great trouble, agitate: Ac 16:20.†

to stretch out or forth: τ. χεῖρα (as often in LXX), Mt 8:3 12:13 14:31 26:51, Mk 1:41 3:5, Lk 5:13 6:10 Jo 21:18, Ac 26:1; seq. ἐπί, c. acc pers., towards, Mt 12:49; against, Lk 22:53; εἰς ἴασιν, Ac 4:30; of anchors, to cast, Ac 27:30.†
to bring to an end, finish, complete: Lk 14:29-30.†
zeal, intentness, earnestness (cf. Deiss., BS, 262): Ac 26:7.†
stretched, strained. Metaph., earnest, zealous: I Pe 4:8 .†
fervently, earnestly: Ac 12:5, I Pe 1:22; compar., Lk 22:44 (WH br., R, mg., omits).†
to set out, expose: Ac 7:21, Metaph., to set forth, expound: Ac 11:4 28:23; c. acc rei, Ac 18:26.†
to shake off: κονιορτόν, Mt 10:14; χοῦν, Mk 6:11. Mid.: κονιορτόν, Ac 13:51; ἱμάτια, Ac 18:6 (cf. MM, Exp., iii).†
the sixth: Mt 20:5, al

as adv., outside, beyond: τὸ ἐ., c. poss. gen., the outside, Mt 23:26; in late Gk. (v. Deiss., BS, 118), pleonastic, ἐκτός εἰ μή, I Co 14:5 15:2, I Ti 5:19.; With force of prep., c. gen.; outside of: I Co 6:18, II Co 12:2; beyond, besides, except: Ac 26:22, I Co 15:27.†

to turn out of the course, turn aside, c. acc Pass., with middle sense, intrans., to turn aside: He 12:13 (R, txt., for be put out of joint, R, mg., v. Thayer, s.v. Westc., in l); fig., seq. εἰς, I Ti 1:6; ἐπί, II Ti 4:4; ὀπίσω, I Ti 5:15; c. acc, to shun, avoid: I Ti 6:20.†
prop., of children, to nurture, bring up: Eph 6:4.; to nourish: Eph 5:29.†
exceedingly terrified: He 12:21 (for exx. from π., v. Deiss., BS, 290; LAE, 254).†
an abortion, an untimely birth (v. Field, Notes, 179): I Co 15:8.†

to carry out, bring out: c. acc rei, Lk 15:22, I Ti 6:7; c. acc pers., Mk 8:23, Ac 5:15; of the dead for burial (cf. κομίζω), Ac 5:6, 9-10.; to bring forth; of women (Hipp., Arist., al.); of the ground (Hdt.): He 6:8.†
to flee away, escape: absol., Ac 16:27, I Th 5:3, He 2:3; seq. ἐκ, Ac 19:10; c. acc pers., He 12:25; c. acc rei, Lk 21:36, Ro 2:3; τ. χεῖρας αὐτοῦ, II Co 11:33.†
to frighten away, terrify: c. acc pers., II Co 10:9.†
affrighted, terrified: Mk 9:16, He 12:21.†
to cause to grow out, put forth (leaves): Mt 24:32, Mk 13:28.†

to pour out: φιάλην, Re 16:1-4, 8 16:10, 12 16:17; κέρματα, Jo 2:15; αἷμα, Mt 23:35 (cf. MM, Exp., xii), Lk 11:50, Ac 22:20, Ro 3:15 (LXX) Re 16:6. Pass., αἷμα, Mt 26:28, Mk 14:24, Ac 22:20; οἶνος, Mt 9:17, Lk 5:37; σπλάγχνα, Ac 1:18. Metaph., τ. πνεῦμα, Ac 2:17-18 (LXX), Ac 2:33 10:45, Tit 3:6; ἀγάπη, Ro 5:5 (cf. Si 36:8, ὀργήν); pass., of persons (like Lat. effundor), to give oneself up to (RV, ran riotously in): Ju 11.†
Hellenistic form of ἐκχέω, q.v. (E1., § 17): Mt 23:35 26:28, Mk 14:24, Lk 5:37 11:50 22:20, Ac 1:18 10:45 22:20, Ro 5:5, Ju 11.†; ἐκ-χωρέω, -ῶ; to depart, withdraw: Lk 21:21.†
to expire, breathe one's last: Ac 5:5, 10 12:23 (cf. ἐκπνέω; Cremer, 906).†
willing, of one's own free will: Ro 8:20, I Co 9:17 (Cremer, 246).†

an olive tree: Ro 11:17, 24, Re 11:4; τ. ὄρος τῶν ἐ. (זַיִת הַר, Za 14:4), the Mount of Olives: Mt 21:1 24:3 26:30, Mk 11:1 13:3 14:26, Lk 19:37 22:39; τὸ καλούμενον ἐ. (T, ἐλαιών, q.v.), Lk 19:29 21:37.; an olive (Aristoph.): Ja 3:12.†
olive-oil: Lk 16:6, Re 6:6 18:13; for lamps, Mt 25:3-4, 8; for healing, Mk 6:13, Lk 10:34, Jo 5:14; for anointing at feasts, Lk 7:46, He 1:9 (LXX).†

olive-grove, olive-garden (so in FlJ and in π.; Deiss., BS, 209 ff.; MM, Exp., iii; M, Pr., 49, 69, 235): Lk 19:29 21:37 (WH, -ῶν; v. their App., 158; Field, Notes, 73; El., § 10, 5; 33, 1; Thayer, s.v.), Ac 1:12 (where EL, ll c., proposes the conjectural emendation ἐλαιῶν for -ῶνος).†
an Elamite: Ac 2:9.†
less, in age, rank or quality: Jo 2:19, Ro 9:12 (LXX), He 7:7; neut., -ον, adverbially: I Ti 5:9.†
to be less (RV, had no lack): II Co 8:15 (LXX) (a rare word; cf. MM, Exp., xii).†
to make less: He 2:7 (LXX); pass., Jo 3:30, He 2:9.†
to drive: of the wind, Ja 3:4, II Pe 2:17; of sailors rowing or sailing a boat, Mk 6:48, Jo 6:19; of demons, Lk 8:29 (cf. ἀπ-, συν-ελαύνω).†
lightness, levity: II Co 1:17.†
light in weight easy to bear: Mt 11:30; θλίψρις (EV, our light affliction), II Co 4:17.†

smallest, least: as proper superlat., I Co 15:9; elsewhere, as usually in late Gk., intensive (B1., § 11, 3); Mt 2:6 (LXX) Mt 25:40, 45 Lk 12:26 16:10 19:17, I Co 4:3 6:2, Ja 3:4; ἐ. ἐν τ. βασιλείᾳ τ. οὐρανῶν, Mt 5:19 (v. Dalman, Words, 113). Compar., ἐλαχιστότερος (for corresp. superl., v. LS; v. also Bl., § 44, 3); less than the least: Eph 3:8.†
less than the least: Eph 3:8.†
Eleazar: Mt 1:15.†
in NT: Ro 9:16, Ju 23, WH.†
reproof: II Ti 3:16.†
re­buke: II Pe 2:16.†
a proof, test: He 11:1.†

in Hom., to treat with contempt.; to convict: c. acc, Mt 18:15 (RV, show him his fault), Tit 1:9; seq. περί, Jo 8:46 16:8, Ju 15; pass., Ja 2:9.; to reprove, re­buke: I Ti 5:20, II Ti 4:2, Tit 1:13 2:15, Re 3:19; pass., seq. περί, Lk 3:19; ὑπό, He 12:5 (LXX).; to expose: Eph 5:11; pass., Jo 3:20, I Co 14:24 (RV reprove, mg. convict), Eph 5:13 (RV, as 1 Co, l.c., of. AR on Eph 5:11; MM, Exp., xii; cf. ἐξ-, δια-κατ-ελέγχομαι).†
pitiable, miserable: Re 3:17; comparat., I Co 15:19.†

to have pity or mercy on, to show mercy: absol., Ro 9:16 12:8; c. acc, Mt 9:27 15:22 17:15 18:33 20:30-31, Mk 5:19 10:47-48, Lk 16:24 17:13 18:38-39 Ro 9:15, 18 11:32, Phl 2:27, Ju 22. Pass., to have pity or mercy shown one (EV, obtain mercy): Mt 5:7, Ro 11:30-31, I Co 7:25, II Co 4:1, I Ti 1:13 1:16, I Pe 2:10.†

mercy, pity.; almsgiving, alms (like the German Almosen, a corruption of the Greek word ἐ): Mt 6:4; ποιεῖν ἐ., Mt 6:2-3, Ac 9:36 10:2 24:17; ἐ. διδόναι, Lk 11:41 (cf. Mt 23:36; Dalman, Words, 62 f.) 12:33; αἰτεῖν, Ac 3:2; λαβεῖν, Ac 3:3; πρὸς (in order to ask) ἐ., Ac 3:10; pl., Ac 10:4, 31 (Cremer, 711).†
merciful: Mt 5:7, He 2:17.†
Elizabeth: Lk 1:5 ff.†

mercy, pity, compassion; of men: Mt 9:13 (LXX) Mt 12:7 23:23; ποιεῖν ἔ. (and id. seq. μετά, c. gen.; cf. Heb. עִם חֶסֶד עָשָׂה, Ge 21:23, al.), Lk 10:37, Ja 2:13 3:17.; Of God: Lk 1:50, 54 1:58, Ro 15:9, Eph 2:4, II Ti 1:16 1:18, Tit 3:5, He 4:16, I Pe 1:3; esp. in benedictions, Ga 6:16, I Ti 1:2, II Ti 1:2, II Jn 3, Ju 2; σκευὴ ἐλέους, Ro 9:23; σπλάγχνα ἐλέους, Lk 1:78; ποιεῖν ἔ. (v. supr.), Lk 1:72; τ. ὑμετέρῳ ἐλέει, Ro 11:31.; Of Christ: Ju 21.†

liberty: with reference to the religious life, I Co 10:29, II Co 3:17, Ga 2:4 5:1, I Pe 2:16, II Pe 2:19; ὁ νόμος τῆς ἐ., Ja 1:25 2:12; ἡ ἐ. τῆς δόξης, Ro 8:21; ἐπ' ἐ., Ga 5:13 (on which formula, cf. Deiss., LAE, 327 ff.; Cremer, 251).†

free; in civil sense, not a slave: Jo 8:33, I Co 7:21-22 12:13, Ga 3:28, Eph 6:8, Col 3:11, Re 6:15 13:16 19:18; fem., Ga 4:22-23, 30; as regards restraint and obligation in general: Mt 17:26, I Co 9:1; seq. ἐκ, I Co 9:19; ἀπό, Ro 7:3; c. inf., I Co 7:39; from the law, Ga 4:26, I Pe 2:16; from sin, Jo 8:32, 36; τῇ δικαιοσύνῃ, as regards righteousness, Ro 6:20 (Cremer, 249).†
to make free from sin, Jo 8:32, 36; seq. ἀπό, Ro 6:18, 22 8:2, 21; τ. ἐλευθερία (dat. commodi), Ga 5:1 (on the "punctiliar" force of this verb, v. M, Pr. 149; cf. also Cremer, 251).†
a coming: Ac 7:52.†
of ivory: Re 18:12.†
Eliakim, an ancestor of Jesus: Mt 1:13, Lk 3:30.†
a roll: Jo 19:39, WH, txt. (μῖγμα, Rec.; μίγμα, WH, mg., R, txt.).†
Eliezer, an ancestor of Jesus: Lk 3:29.†
indecl.,; Eliud, an ancestor of Jesus: Mt 1:14-15.†
Elisha, the prophet: Lk 4:27.†
to roll, roll up: He 1:12 (LXX), Re 6:14.†
a wound (Hom.).; a sore, an ulcer (Thuc., al.): Lk 16:21, Re 16:2, 11.†
to wound.; to ulcerate; pass., to suffer from sores: pf. ptcp., εἱλκωμίνος (Rec. ἡλκ-), EV, full of sores, Lk 16:20.†

to draw: c. acc rei, Jo 18:10 21:6; c. acc pers., seq. ἔξω, Ac 21:30; εἰς, Ac 16:19, Ja 2:6. Metaph., to draw, lead, impel: Jo 6:44 12:32. (For discussion of ἕ. in Oxyrh. Log., v. Deiss., LAE, 437 ff.)†
with varying usage as to geographical limits; in NT = 'Αχαία (cf. Ac 18:12),; Greece: Ac 20:2.†

a Greek; opp. to βάρβαρος, Ro 1:14; usually in ΝΤ of Greek Gentiles, opp. to Ἰουδαῖοι: Jo 7:35, Ac 11:29 14:1 16:1, 3 18:4 19:19, 17 20:21 21:28 Ro 1:16 2:9-10 3:9 10:12, I Co 1:22 1:24 10:32 12:13, Ga 2:3 3:28, Col 3:11; of proselytes, Jo 12:29, Ac 17:4.†
Greek: τ. Ἑλληνικῇ (sc. γλωσσῇ), Re 9:11.†
a Greek (i.e. Gentile) woman: Mk 7:26, Ac 17:12.†
a Hellenist (RV, Grecian Jew): Ac 6:1 9:29 11:20.†
in Greek: Jo 19:20; Ἑ. (sc. λαλεῖν) γινώσκεις, Ac 21:37 (cf. Field, Notes, 135).†
to charge to one's account, impute: Phm 18 (on parallels, cf. Deiss., LAE, 79 f., 335 f.; Milligan, NTD, 73; MM, Exp., xii); of sin, Ro 5:13 (Cremer, 400).†
Elmadam, an ancestor of Jesus: Lk 3:28.

to look for, expect, hope (for): c. acc rei, Ro 8:24-25, I Co 13:7, He 11:1; c. dat. rei (τ. τύχῃ, Thuc., iii, 97, 2), Mt 12:21; seq. καθώς, II Co 8:5; c. inf., Lk 6:34 23:8, Ac 26:7, Ro 15:24, I Co 16:7, II Co 5:11, Phl 2:19, 23, I Ti 3:14, II Jn 12, III Jn 14; seq. ὅτι, c. pres., Lk 24:21; c. fut., Ac 24:26, II Co 1:13 13:6, Phm 22. As in LXX (WM, § xxxiii, d; and esp. in the pf., Ellic. on I Ti 4:10; Bl., § 59, 2), c. prep.; εἰς, Jo 5:45 (v. Ellis., l.c.), I Pe 3:5; seq. ὅτι, II Co 1:10; ἐπί, c. dat., Ro 15:12 (LXX I Ti 4:10 6:17; ἐν, I Co 15:19; c. acc, I Pe 1:13 (aor. imper. v. Bl., § 58, 2); τ. θεόν, I Ti 5:5 (of. ἀπ-, προ-ελπίζω, v. Cremer, 255).†

expectation (in cl., rarely of evil, mostly of good, and so always in NT), hope; of hope in general: II Co 1:6; c. gen. obj., Ac 16:19; art. inf., Ac 27:20, I Co 9:10; παρ' ἐλπίδα, Ro 4:18; ἐπ' ἐλπίδι, I Co 9:10.; Of religious hope: ἐπ' ἐλπίδι, Ac 2:26 26:6, Ro 4:18 8:20, Tit 1:2; τῇ ἐ. ἐσώθημεν, Ro 8:24; κατ' ἐλπίδα ζωῆς αἰωνίου, Tit 3:7; of the Messianic hope of Israel, Ac 23:6 26:6-7 28:20; of Christian hope, Ro 5:2-5 12:12 15:4, 13, I Co 13:13, II Th 2:16, He 3:6 6:11 7:19 10:23, I Pe 1:3 1:21 3:15; c. gen. obj., Ro 5:2, Col 1:27, I Th 1:3 5:8, Tit 1:2; c. gen. of that on which the hope is based, Ac 26:6, Eph 1:18 4:4, Col 1:23; ὁ θεὸς τῆς ἐ., Ro 15:13; ἔχειν ἐ. (= cl. ἐλπίζειν), Ac 24:15, Ro 15:4, II Co 3:12 10:15, Eph 2:12, I Th 4:13; seq. ἐπί, c. dat., I Jn 3:3; εἰς, Ac 24:15; ὅτι, Ro 8:20, Phl 1:20-21. Meton.,; of the author or ground of hope (cl.): I Th 2:19, I Ti 1:1; c. gen. obj., Col 1:27; of the thing hoped for: Ga 5:5, Col 1:5, Tit 2:13, He 6:18 (Cremer, 252, 712).†
Elymas: Ac 13:8.†
Eloi: Mt 27:46, Mk 15:34 (LXX).†
reflex prop. of first pers., used only in gen., dat. and acc sing.,; of myself: Lk 7:7, al.; ἀπ' ἐ, Jo 5:30 7:17, 28 8:28, 42 10:18 14:10; ὑπ' ἐμαυτόν, Mt 8:9, Lk 7:8
to cast into: seq. εἰς, Lk 12:5 (cf. MM, Exp., vii, 93).†
to dip in: τ. χεῖρα ἐν τ. τρυβλίῳ, Mt 26:23; mid., seq. εἰς, Mk 14:20.†

to step in or on (Soph.), hence; to frequent, haunt, dwell in (Æsch., Eur.); metaph., Col 2:18 (dwelling in, R, txt.; taking, R, mg.); to invade (1Mac, ll c.; metaph., Col, Lc.).; to enter on, come into possession of (Eur., Dem.; LXX, Jos, H. c.); on the difficulties of reading and interpretation in this passage, v. Lft, Col., 194 f., 252; ICC, 268 ff.; Field, Notes, 197; Milligan, NTD, 177; and for exx. from π., MM, Exp., xii (cf. κενεμβ.).†
to set in, put in.; to put on board ship, embark: c. acc pers., seq. εἰς, Ac 27:6.†

to look at: c. acc rei, Mk 8:25; c. dat. pers. (part., seq. λέγει, εἶπεν, cf. Xen., Cyr., i, 3, 2), Mt 19:26, Mk 10:21, 27 14:67, Lk 20:17 22:61 (ἐνέβλεψεν), Jo 1:36, 43; absol., to look, Ac 22:11; metaph., to consider: Mt 6:26.†

to snort in (of horses, Æsch.), hence, to speak or act with deep feeling (DCG, i, 62b); to be moved with anger (cf. ἐμβρίμημα, La 2:6): c. dat., Mk 14:5, Jo 11:33; ἐν ἑαυτῷ, Jo 11:38; to admonish sternly: c. dat., Mt 9:30, Mk 1:43.†
to vomit: fig., Re 3:16.†
to rage against: c. dat., Ac 26:11.†
Immanuel: Mt 1:23 (LXX).†
Emmaus, a place 60 furlongs from Jerusalem: Lk 24:13.†

to abide in: Ac 28:30.; to abide by, be true to: seq. ἐν; τ. πίστει, Ac 14:22; τ. διαθήκῃ, He 8:9 (LXX); c. dat., τ. γεγραμμένοις (dat. ptcp. as in legal formula; cf. Deiss., BS, 248; MM, Exp., xii): Ga 3:10 (LXX).†

poss. prop. of first pers., representing the em­phasized gen. ἐμοῦ,; mine, subjectively and objectively, i.e. belonging to, proceeding from or related to me: Mt 18:20, Mk 8:38, Jo 3:29 (most freq. in this gospel), al.; absol., τὸ ἐμόν, τὰ ἐμά, Mt 20:15 25:27, Lk 15:31, Jo 10:14 16:14-15 17:10; = gen. obj. (cl.), εἰς τ. ἐμὴν ἀvάμνησιν, Lk 22:19, I Co 11:24-25; c. gen. expl., τ. ἐμῇ χειρὶ Παύλου, I Co 16:21, Col 4:18, II Th 3:17
mockery: II Pe 3:3.†
a mocking: He 11:36.†
= Attic προσ-, καταπαίζω,; to mock at, mock (Hdt.): c. dat., Mt 27:29, 31, Mk 15:20, Lk 14:29 22:63 23:36; pass., Mt 2:16, Lk 18:32; absol., Mt 20:19 27:41, Mk 10:34 15:31, Lk 23:11.†
a mocker: II Pe 3:3, Ju 18.†
to fill full, fill up, satisfy: c. acc pers. et gen. rei, Lk 1:53, Ac 14:17; pass., Lk 6:25, Jo 6:12; metaph., c. gen. pers., to take one's fill of: Ro 15:24 (cf. Da LXX Su 32).†
to set on fire: πόλιν, Mt 22:7; pass., of the body, to become inflamed: Ac 28:6 (T; πίμπρημι WH, q.v.).†
to fall into: seq. εἰς, Mt 12:11, Lk 6:39 10:36; metaph., εἰς κρίμα, I Ti 3:6; ὀνειδισμόν I Ti 3:7; πειρασμόν, I Ti 6:9; εἰς χεῖρας θεοῦ (cf. II Ki 24:14, I Ch 21:13, Si 2:18), He 10:31.†
to weave in, entwine; pass., metaph., to be involved, entangled in: II Ti 2:4, II Pe 2:20.†
a braiding: τριχῶν, I Pe 3:3.†
to travel, esp. for business.; to traffc, trade: Ja 4:13.; C. acc rei; to traffic in; to import: (Ho 12:1, for יָבַל hoph.).; C. acc pers., to make a gain of: II Pe 2:3.†
commerce, business, trade: Mt 22:5.†
a trading place, exchange: οἶκος ἐμπορίου, Jo 2:16.†
a passenger on shipboard, one on a journey.; a merchant: Mt 13:45, Re 18:3, 11 18:15, 23.†

of place (in cl. also of time),; adverbially, before, in front: Lk 19:28; εἰς τὸ ἔ., Lk 19:4; opp. to ὄπισθεν, Re 4:6; opp. to τὰ ὀπίσω, τὰ ἔ., Phl 3:13.; As prep., before; in front of: Mt 5:24 6:2 7:6 11:10 27:29, Lk 5:19 7:27 14:2, Jo 3:28 10:4, Re 19:10 22:8; in the presence of: Mt 27:11, Ga 2:14, I Th 1:3 2:19 3:9 3:13; ὁμολουεῖν, ἀρνεῖσθαι (Dalman, Words, 210), Mt 10:32, 36 26:70, Lk 12:8; in forensic sense, Mt 25:32 27:11, Lk 21:36, Ac 18:17, II Co 5:10, I Th 2:19, I Jn 3:19; εὐδοκία (θέλημά) ἐστι ἔ. θεοῦ (a targumic formula; Dalman, Words, 211), Mt 11:26 18:14, Lk 10:21; in the sight of: Mt 5:16 6:1 17:2 23:14, Mk 2:12 9:2, Lk 19:27, Jo 12:37, Ac 10:4; of rank and dignity (Dem., Plat., al.; LXX, Ge 48:20): Jo 1:15, 30.†
= cl., καταπτύω (Ruth., NPhr., 66),; to spit upon: c. dat., Mk 10:34 14:65 15:19; seq. εἰς, Mt 26:67 27:30. Pass., Lk 18:32.†
manifest: Ac 10:40; metaph., Ro 10:20 (LXX) (v.s. ἐπιφανής).†

to manifest, exhibit: ἐαυτόν, c. dat pers., Jo 14:21-22 (DCG, ii, 112b). Pass. and mid., to show oneself, appear: Mt 27:53, He 9:24 (cf. MM, Exp., xii).; to declare, make known: seq. ὅτι, He 11:14; c. dat. pers., Ac 23:15; c acc rei, seq. πρός, Ac 23:22; κατά, c. gen. pers., Ac 24:1 25:2; περί, Ac 25:15.†
terrible.; in fear (of Godly fear, Si 19:24), terrified: Lk 24:5, 37, Ac 10:4 24:25, Re 11:13.†
to breathe into (cf. Ge 2:7, Wi 15:11, a1.), breathe upon: Jo 20:22.†
innate (Wi 12:10).; rooted, implanted: Ja 1:21 (v. Mayor, in l).†

Of place, c. dat. rei, pers., in, within, on, at, by, among: ἐν τ. πόλει, Lk 7:37; τ. οφθαλμῷ, Mt 7:3; τ. κοιλίᾳ, Mt 12:40; τ. ὄρει, II Pe 1:18; τ. θρόνῳ, Re 3:21; τ. δεξιᾷ τ. θεοῦ, Ro 8:34; ἐν ἡμῖν Abbott-Smith has ὑμῖν., Lk 1:1; of books, ἐν τ. βιβλίῳ, Ga 3:10; τ. νόμῳ, Mt 12:5, al.; ἐν τοῖς τ. Πατρός, in my Father's house (RV; cf. M, Pr., 103), Lk 2:49; trop., of the region of thought or feeling, ἐν τ. καρδίᾳ (-αις), Mt 5:28, II Co 4:6, al.; τ. συνειδήσεσιν, II Co 5:11; after verbs of motion, instead of εἰς (constructio praegnans, a usage extended in late Gk. beyond the limits observed in cl.; cf. Bl., §41, 1; M, Th., 12), ἀποστέλλω . . . ἐν, Mt 10:16. δέδωκεν ἐν τ. χειρί (cf. τιθέναι ἐν χερσί, Hom., Il., i, 441, al.), Jo 3:35; id. after verbs of coming and going (not in cl.), εἰσῆλθε, Lk 9:46; ἐξῆλθεν, Lk 7:17. Of state, condition, form, occupation, etc.: ἐν ζωῇ, Ro 5:10; ἐν τ. θανάτῳ, I Jo 3:14; ἐν πειρασμοῖς, I Pe 1:6; ἐν εἰρήνῃ, Mk 5:25; ἐν δόξῃ, Phl 4:19; ἐν πραΰτητι, Ja 3:13; ἐν μυστηρίῳ, I Co 2:7; ἐν τ. διδαχῇ, Mk 4:2; of a part as contained in a whole, ἐν τ. ἀμπέλῳ, Jo 15:4; ἐν ἑνὶ σώματι, Ro 12:4; of accompanying objects or persons (simple dat. in cl.), with, ἐν αἵματι, He 9:25; ἐν δέκα χιλιάσιν, Lk 14:31 (cf. Ju 14, Ac 7:14); similarly (cl.), of clothing, armour, arms, ἐν στολαῖς, Mk 12:38; ἐν ἐσθῆτι λαμπρᾷ, Ja 2:2; ἐν μαξαίρῃ, Lk 22:49; ἐν ῥάβδῳ, I Co 4:21 (cf. ἐν τόξοις, Xen., Mem., 3, 9, 2); of manner (cl.), ἐν τάχει (= ταχέως), Lk 18:8 (cf. Bl., §41, 1); of spiritual influence, ἐν πνεύματι, Ro 8:9; ἐν π. ἀκαθάρτῳ, Mk 1:23; of the mystical relation of the Christian life and the believer himself, to God and Christ (cf. ICC, Ro., 160f.; Mayor on Ju 1; M, Pr., 103): ἐν Χριστῷ, Ro 3:24, 6:11, I Co 3:1, 4:10, II Co 12:2, Ga 2:17, Eph 6:21, Col 4:7, I Th 4:16, al. Of the agent, instrument or means (an extension of cl. ἐν of instr.—v. LS, s.v. Ill—corresponding to similar use of Heb. בְּ), by, with: ἐν ὑμῖν κρίνεται ὁ κόσμος (= cl. παρά, C. dat.), I Co 6:2; ἐν τ. ἄρχοντι τ. δαιμονίων, Mt 9:34; ἐν αἵματι, He 9:22; ἐν ὕδατι, Mt 3:11, al.; ἐν μαχαίρᾳ ἀποκτενεῖ (cf. the absol. ἐν μ., ἐν ῥάβδῳ, supr., II, which some would classify here), Re 13:10 (cf. 6:8). Allied to this usage and distinctly Semitic are the following: ἠγόρασας . . . ἐν τ. αἵματι σου (cf. BDB, s.v. בְּ, III, 3), Re 5:9; ὁμολογεῖν ἐν (= Aram. אודי בּ; cf. McNeile on Mt, I.c.; M, Pr., 104), Mt 10:32, Lk 12:8; ὀμνύναι ἐν (= cl. acc., so Ja 5:12), Mt 5:34, al.; also at the rate of, amounting to, Mk 4:8 (WH; vv. ll., εἰς, ἒν), Ac 7:14 (LXX). Of time, in or during a period: ἐν τ. ἡμέρᾳ (νυκτί), Jo 11:9, al.; ἐν σαββάτῳ, Mt 12:2, al.; ἐν τῷ μεταξύ, meanwhile, Jo 4:31; at the time of an event: ἐν τ. παρουσίᾳ, I Co 15:23; ἐν τ. ἀναστάσει, Mt 22:28; c. art. inf., pres. (so sometimes in cl., but not as in NT = ἕως; V. M, Pr., 215), while: Mt 13:4, Mk 6:48, Ga 4:18, al.; aor., when, after: Lk 9:36, al.; within (cl.): Mt 27:40, In composition: (1) meaning: (a) with adjectives, it signifies usually the possession of a quality, as ἐνάλιος, ἐν́δοξος; (b) with verbs, continuance in (seq. ἐν) or motion into (seq. εἰς), as ἐμμένω, ἐμβαίνω. (ii) Assimilation: ἐν becomes ἐμ- before β, μ, π, φ, ψ; ἐγ- before γ, κ, ξ, χ; ἐλ- before λ. But in the older MSS of NT, followed by modern editions, assimilation is sometimes neglected, as in ἐνγράφω, ἐγκαινίζω, etc.
to take into one's arms: Mk 9:36 10:16.†
of the sea: τὰ ἐ., marine creatures, Ja 3:7.†
a κοινή word (MM, Exp., xii),; before; as prep., c. gen.: Lk 1:8, Ac 7:10 (WH, ἐναντίον), Ac 8:21.†

over against, opposite, contrary: ἄνεμος, Mt 14:24, Mk 6:48, Ac 27:4; ἐξ ἐναντίας (ellipse obscure, v. Bl., § 44,1; Mozley, Ps 42:1-11), c. gen., Mk 15:39. Metaph., opposed, hostile: I Th 2:15, Ac 26:9 28:17; ὁ ἐξ ἐ., Tit 2:8. Neuter., -ίον, adv., as prep. c. gen., before, in the presence of: Lk 1:6 20:26 24:19 Ac 7:10 (ἔναντι, T), Ac 8:32 (LXX).†
to begin, make a beginning: Ga 3:3, Phl 1:6.†
ninth: Re 21:20; of the ninth hour (3 o'clock, p.m.), Mt 20:5 27:45-46, Mk 15:33-34, Lk 23:44, Ac 3:1 10:3, 30.†
in want, needy: Ac 4:34,†
a plain token, proof: II Th 1:5 (cf. ἔνδειξις, which refers rather to the "act of proving"; ἔ., with the passive formation, to the thing proved, v. Lft., Notes, 100; M, Th., l.c.).†

to mark, point out. Mid„; to show forth, prove: c. acc rei, Ro 2:15 9:22, Eph 2:7, Tit 2:10 3:2, He 6:11; seq. ἐν, c. dat. pers., Ro 9:17 (LXX), I Ti 1:16; seq. εἰς, He 6:10 (c. cogn. acc), II Co 8:24.; to manifest (by act): c. acc rei et dat. pers., II Ti 4:14 (cf. Ge 50:15, 17, and v. MM, Exp., xiii).†
a pointing out, showing forth, proof (v.s. ἔνδειγμα): Ro 3:25-26, II Co 8:24, Phl 1:28.†
indecl.,; eleven: of the eleven apostles, οἱ, ἕ., Mt 28:16, Mk 16:14, Lk 24:9, 33, Ac 1:26 2:14.†
eleventh: Mt 20:6, 9, Re 21:20.†
to admit, approve.; to be possible; impers., ἑνδέχεται, it is possible: c. acc et inf., Lk 13:33 (Cremer, 687).†
to live in a place, be at home: ἐν τ. σώματι, II Co 5:6 5:9; πρὸς τ. Kύριον, II Co 5:8.†
to put on: c. dupl. acc, Mk 15:17 (ἐνδύουσι, Rec.). Mid., to put on oneself, be clothed in: c. acc rei, Lk 16:19 (cf. MM, Exp., xii).†
righteous, just: Ro 3:8, He 2:2 (Cremer, 204).†
to glorify: pass., II Th 1:10-12.†
held in honour, of high repute: I Co 4:10.; glorious, splendid: of deeds, τά ἔ., Lk 13:17; of clothing, Lk 7:25. Metaph., ἐκκλησία, Eph 5:27 (cf. παράδοξος).†
raiment, clothing, a garment: Mt 3:4 6:25, 28 7:15 22:11-12 28:3, Lk 12:23.†
to make strong, strengthen: c. acc, pers., Phl 4:13, I Ti 1:12, II Ti 4:17. Pass., Ac 9:22; C. dat., Ro 4:20; seq. ἐν, II Ti 2:1 (ἐν Κυρίῳ), Eph 6:10 (Cremer, 221).†
a putting on: ίματίων, I Pe 3:3.†

c. acc pers., Mt 27:28 (WH, mg., R, mg.); c. dupl. acc, Mt 27:31, Mk 15:20, Lk 15:22; mid., to put on oneself, be clothed with: c. acc rei, Mt 6:25, Mk 6:9, Lk 8:27 12:22, Ac 12:21; ptcp., Mt 22:11, Mk 1:6, II Co 5:3, Re 1:13 15:6 19:14; of armour (fig.): Ro 13:12, Eph 6:11, 14, I Th 5:8; metaph., δύναμιν, Lk 24:49; ἀφθαρσίαν, ἀθανασίαν, I Co 15:53-54; τ. καινὸν ἄνθρωπον, Eph 4:24, Col 3:10; σπλάγχνα οἰκτιρμοῦ, Col 3:12; Ἰησ. Χριστόν, Ro 13:14, Ga 3:27,; to enter, press into: II Ti 3:6 (cf. ἐπ-ενδύω).†
a build­ing in: ἡ ἐ. τ. τείχους αὐτῆς ἴασπις, its wall had jasper built into it, Re 21:18 (v. MM, Exp., xiii; Swete, Ap., l.c.).†
a lying in wait, an ambush: Ac 23:16 (Rec. ἔνεδρον, a form freq. in LXX), Ac 25:8.†
to lie in wait for: c. acc pers., Lk 11:54, Ac 23:21.†
to roll in, wind in: c. acc pers. et dat. rei, Mk 15:46.†
to be in, within (Jb 27:3, al.): ptcp. pl., τὰ ἐνόντα, Lk 11:41 (R, txt., cf. MM, Exp., xii).; to be possible: Lk 11:41 (R, mg.).†

on account of, because of: Mt 5:10-11 16:25 19:29, Mk 8:35, Lk 6:22, Ac 28:20, Ro 8:36, II Co 3:10; ἕ. τούτου, Mt 19:5; υούτων, Ac 26:21; τίνος ἕ., Ac 19:32; seq. τοῦ, c. inf., II Co 7:12; οὗ ἕν., Lk 4:18
dumb, speechless: Ac 9:7.†
operative power (as distinct from δύναμις, potential power), working: of God, Eph 1:19 3:7 4:16, Phl 3:21, Col 1:29 2:12; of Satan, II Th 2:9 2:11 (cf. M, Th., l.c.; AR, Eph., 241 ff.; Cremer, 261).†

intrans., to be at work or in action, to operate (opp. to ἀργέω): seq. ἐν, c. dat. pers., Mt 14:2, Mk 6:14, Eph 2:2; c. dat. pers., seq. εἰς (Lft., in l), Ga 2:8.; Trans., to work, effect, do: c. acc rei, I Co 12:11, Eph 1:11; id, seq. ἐν, c. dat. pers., I Co 12:6, Ga 3:5, Phl 2:13; ἐ. ἐνέργειαν, Eph 1:19-20 Pass. (taken as mid. by Lft., Ga., 204 f.; but v. AR, Eph., l.c.; Milligan, Th., 28 f.; Mayor, Ja., 177 ff.), in NT, "always used of some principle or power at work" (Meyer), to be actuated, set in operation: II Th 2:7; seq. ἐν, Ro 7:5, II Co 1:6 4:12, Eph 3:20, Col 1:29, I Th 2:13; seq. διά, c. gen. rei, Ga 5:6; ἐνεργουμένη (M, Pr., 156), Ja 5:16 (Cremer, 262).†
effect, operation (Polyb.): pl., I Co 12:6 12:10 (Cremer, 262, 713).†
at work, active, effective: I Co 16:9, Phm 6, He 4:12 (Cremer, 261).†
to bless: pass., seq. ἐν, Ac 3:25 (LXX), Ga 3:8 (LXX) (Cremer, 770).†

to hold in; pass., to be held, entangled: c. dat. rei; jig., ζυγῷ δουλείας, Ga 5:1 (cf. MM, Exp., xii); θλίψρεσιν, II Th 1:4 (cf. ἀσεβείσιν, 3Mac, l.c.).; to set oneself against, be urgent against (as Ge, l.c.; for con­struction, v. Swete, Mk., l.c.): Mk 6:19, Lk 11:53.†
to reflect on, ponder: c. acc rei, Mt 1:20 9:4.†
consideration, pondering (EV, device): Ac 17:29; pl., thoughts, feel­ings: Mt 9:4 12:25, He 4:12.†
= ἔνεστι,; is in, has place, can be: I Co 6:5, Ga 3:28 (tris) Col 3:11, Ja 1:17 (cf. Lft., Ga.; Hort and Mayor, Ja., ll. c.).†

prop., a cycle of time.; = ἔτος, a year: Jo 11:49, 51 18:13, Ac 11:26 18:11, Ja 5:17, Re 9:15; pl., of sabbatical years, Ga 4:10; ποιεῖν ἐ., to spend a year, Ja 4:13;ἅπαξ τοῦ ἐ., He 9:7; κατ' ἐ., He 9:25 10:1, 3; ἐ. δεκτόν, Lk 4:19 (LXX).†

to place in; in pf., plpf., 2 aor. and in mid., intrans.; to be at hand, impend, threaten: II Ti 3:1; to be present: II Th 2:2 (but v. Thayer, s.v.); pf. ptcp., present: I Co 7:26, Ga 1:4, He 9:9; pl., Ro 8:38, I Co 3:22 (Cremer, 3O9).†
to strengthen: in spiritual sense, Lk 22:43; pass., Ac 9:19 (Rec. ἐνισχύσεν, became strong, as in LXX, Ge 12:10 48:2, al.).†
suborned to lie in wait, lying in wait: as subst., Lk 20:20.†
dedication (anniversary of the cleansing of the Temple from the defilements of Antiochus Epiphanes) : Jo 10:22.†
1. to innovate (Eust.). 2. to renew (LXX ut supr.). 3. to initiate, inaugurate, dedicate (LXX ut supr.) : διαθήκην, He 9:18 ; ὁδόν, ib. 10:20 (Cremer, 323).†
to lose heart : Lk 18:1, II Co 4:1,16, Ga 6:9, Eph 3:13, II Th 3:13 (Cremer, 330).†
to dwell among: seq. ἐν, II Pe 2:8.†
to take pride in, glory in: seq. ἐν, II Th 1:4.†
to ingraft, graft in. fig., c. acc. pers., Ro 11:17,19,23,24.†
1. an incision, a cutting, break. 2. Metaph., an interruption, a hindrance: I Co 9:12.†
1. to cut into (as in breaking up a road), hence, 2. to hinder: c. acc. Ac 24:4, I Th 2:18, . inf., Ga 5:7; seq. τοῦ, c. inf., Ro 15:22; εἰς τό, c. inf, I Pe 3:7.†
to reckon among : ἑαυτούς, II Co 10:12.†
pregnant, big with child : Lk 2:5.†
nine: Lk 17:17; ἐνενήκοντα ἐ., Mt 18:12-13, Lk 15:4, 7.†
to nod to, make a sign to: c. dat. pers., Lk 1:62.†
thinking, consideration.; a thought, purpose, design: He 4:12, I Pe 4:1.†
lawful, legal (MM, Exp., xiii): Ac 19:39.; Of persons,; law-abiding; under law: ἔ. Χριστοῦ, in relation to Christ, I Co 9:21 (Cremer. 435).†
nightly. Neut., adverbially, ἔννυχα (Rec. -χον), by night: Mk 1:35.†
to dwell in; metaph., seq. ἐν, c. dat. pers: ὁ θεός, II Co 6:16; τ. πνεῦμα, Ro 8:11, II Ti 1:14; ὁ λόγος, Col 3:16; πίστις, II Ti 1:5; ἁμαρτία, Ro 7:17.†
to adjure: c. dupl. acc (like ορκίζω, q.v.), ὑμᾶς τ. κῦριον, I Th 5:27.†
unity, unanimity: Eph 4:3, 13.†
to trouble: c. acc, He 12:15. Pass., seq. ἀπό, Lk 6:18.†

held in, bound by: c. gen. (cl. c. dat.), δουλείας, He 2:15.; In law-phrases; liable to a charge or action (cl. c. dat., of crime): c. dat., of the tribunal (MM, Exp., xiii), Mt 5:21-22; seq. εἰς (Field, Notes, 4 f.), Mt 5:22; c. gen., of the punishment (Ge 26:11): θανάτου, Mt 26:66, Mk 14:64; c. gen. (cl. c. dat„ rarely c. prep.; MM, Exp., xiii), of the crime (II Mac 13:6): Mk 3:29; c. gen., of the thing injured, guilty (absol., in Cl.): I Co 11:27, Ja 2:10 (cf. Is 54:17; DB, ii, 268a).†
to walk about in or among: seq. ἐν., dat. pers., II Co 6:16 (LXX),†
to breathe on.; to breathe; absol.; c. gen. part.: fig., ἀπειλῆς κ. φόνου, Ac 9:1.†
a precept: pl., Mt 15:9 (LXX), Mk 7:7, Col 2:22.†
a κοινή word (Deiss., LAE, 723),; to prepare for burial: Mt 26:12, Jo 19:40.†
preparation for burial: Mk 14:8, Jo 12:7.†

-ομαι, to command, enjoin, instruct: seq. περί He 11:22; c. inf., Mt 19:7; c. dat. pers., Ac 1:2; οὕτως, Ac 13:47; καθώς, Jo 14:31 (ἐντολὴν ἔδωκεν, WH); seq. λέγων, Mt 17:9; c. inf., Jo 8:5; ἵνα, Mk 13:34; c. acc rei, Mt 28:20, Mk 10:3, Jo 15:14, 17; seq. περί, c. gen. pers., Mt 4:6 and Lk 4:10 (LXX); διαθήκην ἐ. πρός, c. acc pers., He 9:20 (LXX) (cf. Si 45:3).†; κελεύω, to command, of verbal orders in general; παραγγέλλω, to charge, esp. of the transmitted orders of a military com­mander; ἐντέλλω points rather to the contents of the command (v. Thayer, s.v. κελεύω)

of place, hence: Lk 4:9 13:31, Jo 2:16 7:3 14:31 18:36; ἐ. καὶ ἐ. (for cl. ἔνθεν κ. ἔνθεν), on this side and on that, on each side, Jo 19:18; similarly, ἐ. καὶ ἐκεῖθεν, Re 22:2.; Of time, thereupon.; Causal; hence, therefore: Ja 4:1.†; ἔνθεν,; hence: Mt 17:20, Lk 16:26.†
a lighting upon, meeting with.; conversation.; a petition (in this sense common in π.; cf. Deiss., BS, 121 f., 146; MM, Exp., iii): I Ti 4:5; p1., I Ti 2:1.†
honoured, prized, precious: of persons, Lk 7:2, Phl 2:29; compar., Lk 14:8; of things, metaph., λίθος, I Pe 2:4 2:6 (LXX).†

generally, a charge, injunction, order, command: Lk 15:29, Jo 10:18 11:57 12:49-50 14:31, Ac 17:15, Col 4:10; ἐ. σαρκίνη, He 7:16, 18; Esp. of religious precepts and commandments; of God's commandments: in OT, Mt 15:3 22:36, 38 22:40 Mk 7:8-9; Mk 10:5, 19 12:28, 31 Eph 2:15, He 9:19; esp. of the decalogue, Mt 5:19 19:17, Mk 10:19, Lk 18:20 23:56, Ro 7:8-13 13:9, Eph 6:2; of God's command­ments in general, Lk 1:6, I Co 7:19, I Jn 2:3-8 Jn 3:22-24 Jn 4:21 Jn 5:2-3, Re 12:17 14:12; collectively, ἡ ἐ. (cf. τ. ἔργον τ. θεοῦ, Jo 6:29), I Ti 6:14, II Pe 2:21 3:2; of things commanded Christ by the Father: Jo 12:49-50 14:31 15:10; of the precepts of Christ: Jo 13:34 14:15, 21 15:10, 12, I Co 14:37.; Phrases: seq. ἵνα, Jo 13:34 15:12, I Jn 3:23 Jn 4:21, II Jn 6; ἐντολὴν (ὰς) παραβαίνειν, Mt 15:3; ἀκυροῦν, Mt 15:6 Rec.; τηρεῖν, Mt 19:17 Jo 15:10, al.; ποιεῖν, I Jn 5:2; διδόναι, Jo 11:57; λαμβάνειν, Jo 10:18, II Jn 4; ἔχειν, Jo 14:21, He 7:5; ἐ. καὶ δικαιώματα, Lk 1:6; ἐντολαὶ ἀνθρώπων (of Jewish tradition), Tit 1:14; i. καινή, Jo 13:34, I Jn 2:7, II Jn 5.†
of a place, resident: Ac 21:12.†
within: c. gen., ἐ. ὑμῶν, within you (i.e. in your hearts, R, txt.), or among you (R, mg.), Lk 17:21 (cf. Field, Notes, 71; Thayer, s.v.; ICC, Lk, l.c.; Dalman, Words, 145 ff.); τὸ ἐ., Mt 23:26.†

to turn about; metaph., put to shame: c. acc, I Co 4:14; pass., II Th 3:14, Tit 2:8; mid., to reverence: c. acc pers. (cl. c. gen.), Mt 21:37, Mk 12:6, Lk 18:2, 4 20:13, He 12:9 (cf. MM, Exp., iii, xiii).†
to train up, nurture; pass., metaph., τοῖς λόγοις τ. πίστεως, I Ti 4:6.†
trembling with fear (Pint.): Ac 7:32 16:29, He 12:21 (ἔκτρ-, WH, mg.).†
c. gen. pers., respect, reverence (Soph., Polyb., al.).; Absol., shame (Hipp.): I Co 6:5 15:34.†
to revel in: ἐν-τ. ἀπάταις, II Pe 2:13 (v. Mayor, in l).†

to fall in with.; to meet with in order to converse.; to petition, make petition: c. dat. pers., seq. ὑπέρ c. gen. pers., Ac 25:24 (cf. Field, Notes, 140), He 7:25, Ro 8:27, 34 (θεῷ, not expressed); seq. κατά, against: Ro 11:2 (cf. ἔντευξις, ὑπερ-εντυγχάνω).†
to wrap up (LS), roll or coil about (DCG, ii, 227, 507a): c. acc et dat., Mt 27:59 (iv, Tr. [WH], cf. similar sentence in π.; MM, Exp., xiii), Lk 23:53; pass., Jo 20:7.†
to imprint, engrave: pass. ptcp., c. dat., II Co 3:7.†
to insult, mock at: He 10:29.†
to dream: ἐνυπνίοις ἐ., Ac 2:17 (LXX); pres. ptcp., Ju 8.†
a dream: pl., Ac 2:17.†

face to face, in sight (Theocr.; ἄρτοι ἐ., Ex 25:29): neut., ἐνώπιον, in vernacular, with force of prep. c. gen. [in LXX for פָּנִים, עַיִן, etc., cf. Dalman, Words, 31 f., 209 f., and Deiss., BS., 213], in NT, most freq. in Lk, Ac, Re, never in Mt, Mk, before, in the presence of: Lk 1:19 Lk 4:7, Ac 4:10 Ac 6:5, Re 1:4 2:14, al.; esp. ἐ. Κυρίου (θεοῦ), in the sight of God, or with God as witness or as judge, Ro 14:22, I Co 1:29, I Ti 2:3, Ja 4:10, I Pe 3:4, al.
to give ear to, hearken to: c. acc, Ac 2:14.†; Also used for יָחַל שָׁמַע
indecl.,; six: Mt 17:1, Lk 13:14, al.
to tell out, proclaim: I Pe 2:9 [Mk 16:1-20, "shorter conclusion"] (Cremer, 29).†
to redeem, ransom (esp. of slaves): metaph., Ga 3:13 4:5.; to buy up; mid., to buy up for oneself: τ. καιρόν, Eph 5:16, Col 4:5 (Cremer, 60).†

to take out: c. acc, ὀφθαλμόν, Mt 5:29 18:9; mid.; to take out for oneself, choose: Ac 26:17 (Thayer, s.v.; Page, Ac., l.c., but v. infr.); to deliver: Ac 7:10, 34 (LXX) Ac 12:11 Ac 23:27 Ac 26:17 (EV, but v. supr.), Ga 1:4.†
to lift up, lift off the earth, remove: I Co 5:13 (LXX)†
to ask from; mid., to ask for oneself, demand: aor., ἐξῃτήσατο, c. acc (obtained you by asking, R, mg.), Lk 22:31 (v. Field, Notes, 76; Cremer, 73).†
to follow, follow up (in various senses): metaph., II Pe 1:16 2:2 2:15 †
six hundred: Re 13:18 14:20.†

to plaster, wash over (LXX).; to wipe off, wipe out: δάκρυον, Re 7:17 21:4; metaph., χειρόγραφον, Col 2:14; τ. ὄνομα, seq. ἐκ, Re 3:5 (MM, Exp., xiii); pass., ἀμαρτίαι (ἐξαλιφθῆναι, WH), Ac 3:19 (cf. Ps 51:11 Ps 109:13, Is 43:25, Si 46:20 (ἁμ. ἀπαλ-), III Mac 2:19).†
to leap up: Ac 3:8.†
a rising again: ἐκ τ. νεκρῶν, Phl 3:11 (Cremer, 308).†
trans., to cause to spring up (LXX).; Intrans. (as ἀνατέλλω, Ge 3:18), to spring up: Mt 13:5, Mk 4:5.†
trans., to raise up: σπέρμα (cf. Ge 38:8), Mk 12:19, Lk 20:28.; In 2 aor. act., intrans., to rise: Ac 15:5.†
to deceive: c. acc, Ro 7:11 Ro 16:18, I Co 3:18, II Co 11:3, II Th 2:3; pass., I Ti 2:14.†
suddenly: Mk 9:8.†
so in NT, depon. pass., to be utterly at a loss, be in despair: absol. (as Ps, l.c.), II Co 4:8; τοῦ ζῆν, II Co 1:8.†

to send forth: c. acc pers., Ac 7:12 12:11, Ga 4:4; τ. ἐπαγγελίαν, Lk 24:49; τ. πνεῦμα, Ga 4:6; [τ. κήρυγμα, Mk 16:1-20, "shorter conclusion," WH ;] seq. εἰς, Ac 22:21; pass., ὁ λόγος, Ac 13:26.; to send away: c. acc pers., seq. εἰς, Ac 9:30; seq. ἕως, Ac 11:22; c. inf., Ac 17:14; κενόν, Lk 1:53 20:10-11.†
to com­plete, finish: τ. ἡμέρας, Ac 21:5.; to furnish, supply: pass., II Ti 3:17 (for exx., v. MM, Exp., xiii; Cremer, 651).†
to flash like lightning, gleam, be radiant: ἱματισμός, Lk 9:29.†
at once, forthwith: Mk 6:25, Ac 10:33 Ac 11:11 Ac 21:32 Ac 23:30, Phl 2:23.†
to raise up: Ro 9:17 (cf. ICC, in l); from the dead, I Co 6:14.†
to go forth: Ac 13:42 Ac 17:15 Ac 20:7; seq. ἐπί, c. acc, Ac 27:43.†
to convict: Ju 15, Rec. (for ἐλέγχω, WH, q.v.).†
to draw out or away: metaph., ὑπὸ τ. ἐπιθυμίας, Ja 1:14 (v. Mayor, in l).†
a vomit: II Pe 2:22 (LXX).†
to search out, search carefully: seq. περί, I Pe 1:10.†

to go, or come out of: Mt 10:11, Mk 1:35, Jo 13:30, al.; c. inf., Mt 11:8, Mk 3:21, Lk 7:25, 26 Ac 20:8; id. seq. ἐπί, Mt 26:55, al.; εἰς, Mk 1:38; ἵνα, Re 6:2; ἐ. seq. ἐκ (cl. c. gen. loc.), Mk 5:2, Jo 4:30, al.; ἔξω, c. gen., Mt 21:17, Mk 14:68, Ac 16:13, He 13:13; ἀπό, Mk 11:12, Lk 9:5, Phl 4:15; ἐκεῖθεν, Mt 15:21, Mk 6:1, Lk 9:4, al.; of demons expelled, seq. ἐκ (ἀπό), c. gen. pers., Mk 1:25, 26 5:8, Lk 4:35, al.; of prisoners released, Mt 5:26, Ac 16:40; ptcp., ἐξελθών, c. indic., of verb of departure (cf. Dalman, Words, 20f.), Mt 8:32 15:21 24:1, Mk 16:8, Lk 22:39, Ac 12:9, 17 al. Metaph., of persons: II Co 6:17, I Jo 2:19; of birth or origin, Mt 2:6 (LXX), He 7:5 (cf . Ge 35:11); of escape from danger, ἐκ τ. χειρὸς αὐτῶν, Jo 10:39; of public appearance, I Jo 4:1; of things: Mt 24:27; esp. of utterances, reports, proclamations: φωνή, Re 16:17 19:5; φήμη, Mt 9:26, Lk 4:14; ἀκοή, Mk 1:28; λόγος, Jo 21:23; δόγμα, Lk 2:1 (cf. δι-εξέρχομαι).
to examine closely, inquire carefully (of ): seq. περί (c. ἀκριβῶς), Mt 2:8; seq. τίς, Mt 10:11; c. acc pers., Jo 21:12.†
to lead, show the way; metaph., to unfold, narrate, declare: c. acc rei, Lk 24:35 Ac 21:19; c. dat. pers., Ac 10:8; θεόν (understood), Jo 1:18; seq. ὅσα, Ac 15:12; καθώς, Ac 15:14.†
in order, successively, next: τῇ ἑ. ἡμέρᾳ, Lk 9:37; ἐν τῷ ἑ. (sc. χρόνῳ), soon after, Lk 7:11; τῇ ἑ. (sc. ἡμέρα), Ac 21:1 Ac 25:17 Ac 27:18.†
to sound forth (as a trumpet, or thunder; v. M, Th., l.c.): pass., I Th 1:8.†
habit, use, experience: He 5:14.†

causal in Pres., impf., fut., 1 aor., to put out of its place; metaph., ἐ. τινά φρενῶν (Eur.), to drive one out of his senses, hence, absol., to confound, amaze: c. acc pers., Lk 24:22, Ac 8:9, 11.; Intr. in pass. and mid., also in 2 aor., pf., plpf. act., seq. ἐκ or c. gen., to stand aside from, retire from; esp. τ. φρενῶν, to lose one's senses (Eur.), hence, absol.; to be beside oneself, be mad: Mk 3:21, II Co 5:13 (opp. to σωφρονεῖν); to be amazed, confounded: Mt 12:23, Mk 2:12 Mk 5:42 Mk 6:51, Lk 2:47 Lk 8:56, Ac 2:7, 12 Ac 8:13 Ac 9:21 Ac 10:45 Ac 12:16 (Cremer, 309).†
to have strength enough, to be quite able: c. inf., Eph 3:18.†
a going out, departure: He 11:22; of death, Lk 9:31, II Pe 1:15.†
to destroy utterly: seq. ἐκ τ. λαοῦ, Ac 3:23 (LXX).†

act. = cl. ὁμολογέω, to profess or agree to do (Field, Notes, 75): Lk 22:6.; Mid., to acknowledge, confess (MM, Exp., xiv): τ. ἁμαρτίας, Mt 3:6, Mk 1:5, Ja 5:16; τ. πράξεις, Ac 19:18; seq. ὅτι, Phl 2:11; c. dat. pers., to make acknowledgment to one's honour, to praise, give praise to (as in LXX; Kennedy, Sources, 118): Ro 14:11(LXX) Ro 15:9 (LXX); seq. ὅτι, Mt 11:25, Lk 10:21 (Cremer, 771).†
to administer an oath to (Dem., Polyb., al.).; to adjure: c. acc pers., seq. κατά, c. gen. (as freq. in magic π.; MM, Exp., xiv), Mt 26:63.†
one who administers an oath.; an exorcist: Ac 19:13.†
to dig out, dig up: στέγην, Mk 2:4; metaph., ὀφοαλμούς (cf. LXX, ll c.; Herod., viii, 116), Ga 4:15.†
to despise, set at nought: Mk 9:12 (cf. ἐξουθενέω).†

to set at nought, despise utterly, treat with contempt: c. acc pers., Lk 18:9 23:11, Ro 14:3, 10, I Co 16:11; c. acc rei, Ga 4:14, I Th 5:20; pass., of persons: Mk 9:12 (T, -όω), I Co 6:4; of things λίθος, Ac 4:11 (LXX ἀπεδοκίμασαν); λόγος, II Co 10:10; τὰ ἐξουθενημένα, I Co 1:28.†
v.l. for -έω (q.v.): Mk 9:12 T.†

prop., liberty or power to act, freedom to exercise the inward force or faculty expressed by δύναμις (q.v.): I Co 9:12; ἐ. ἔχειν, II Th 3:9; id. seq. inf., Jo 10:18, I Co 9:4, 5; c. gen. obj., Ro 9:21; seq. ἐπί, c. acc., Re 22:14; περί, I Co 7:37. Later (cf. Milligan, Th., 114; MM, Exp., xiv), of the power of right, authority: Mt 21:33, Mk 11:28, Lk 20:2; of Messianic authority, Mt 9:6, Mk 2:10, al.; of apostolic authority, II Co 10:8 13:10; of the authority of government: Mt 8:9 28:18, Ju 25, Re 12:10, al.; esp. of judicial authority, Lk 20:20, Jo 19:10, 11. Meton., jurisdiction: Lk 23:7 (cf. I Mac 6:11, Is 39:2); a ruler or magistrate: Ro 13:1-3; pl., Lk 12:11, Ro 13:1, Tit 3:1; of supramundane powers (syn. with ἀρχή, δύναμις, θρόνος, κυριότης): I Co 15:24, Eph 1:21 3:10, Col 2:10, I Pe 3:22, al. (Cremer. 236).
to exercise authority (Arist.).; Trans., to exercise authority over: c. gen. pers., Lk 22:25; c. gen. rei, I Co 7:4; pass., to be held under authority (v. Lft., Notes, 214): seq. ὑπό, I Co 6:12.†
a projection (ἐ. πέτρας, Jb 39:28).; Metaph., eminence, excellence: οἱ κατ' ἐ., the chief men, Ac 25:23.†
to awaken out of sleep (= ἀφυπνίζω): c. acc pers., Jo 11:11.†
roused out of sleep: Ac 16:27.†

outside, without; adverbially: Mt 12:46, Mk 3:31 11:4, Lk 8:20, Jo 18:16, al.; c. art., ὁ ἔ., he who is without; metaph., in pl., οἱ ἔ., of those outside the Church, I Co 5:12-13, Col 4:5 (Lft., in l), I Th 4:12; ὁ ἔ. ἄνθρωπος, II Co 4:16; αἱ ἔ. πόλεις, Ac 26:11; as prep. c. gen.: Lk 13:33, Ac 21:5, He 13:11-12; After verbs of motion; adverbially, forth, out: Mt 5:13 Mk 14:68, Lk 22:62, Jo 19:4, 13, Ac 9:40, al.; as prep. c. gen., out of: Mt 21:17, Mk 11:19 12:8, Lk 4:29, Ac 7:58, He 13:13, al

prop. (in answer to the question, Whence ?), from without: Mk 7:18; More often (= ἔξω; cf. Bl., § 25, 3), without: Mt 23:27-28 Mk 7:18, II Co 7:5; τὸ ἔ., Mt 23:25, Lk 11:39-40; οἱ ἔ., I Ti 3:7, Mk 4:11 (WH, mg.); ὁ ἔ. κόσμος, I Pe 3:3; ἐκβάλλειν ἔ., Re 11:2. As prep. c. gen.: Mk 7:15, Re 11:1-19 IV Ki 14:20 (cf. Robertson, Gr., 548).†
to thrust out: Ac 7:45.; to drive out of the sea, drive on shore: Ac 27:39 (WH, txt., ἐκσῶσαι).†; *ἐκ-σώζω,; to preserve from danger, bring safe: Ac 27:39 (ἐξῶσαι, WH, mg., R, txt., v.s. ἐξωθέω).†
outer: σκότος, Mt 8:12 Mt 22:13 Mt 25:30.†
to keep festival: I Co 5:8.†

a feast, festival: Lk 2:42, Jo 5:1, Jo 6:4 Jo 7:37, Col 2:10; ἡ ἑ. τοῦ πάσχα, Lk 2:41, Jo 13:1; τ. ἀζύμων, Lk 22:1; ἡ σκηνοπηγία, Jo 7:2 (Deiss., LAE, 116); ἐν τ. ἑ., Mt 26:5, Mk 14:2, Jo 4:45 7:11 12:20 (εἶναι ἐν ἑ.), Jo 2:23; εἰς τ. ἑ. (for the feast), Jo 13:29; ἀναβαίνειν, ἔρχεσθαι εἰς τ. ἑ., Jo 4:45 7:8-10 11:56 12:12; τῆς ἐ μεσούσης, Jo 7:14; κατὰ ἑ. (at each feast), Mt 27:15, Mk 15:6, Lk 23:17, R, mg.; τ. ἑ. ποιεῖν, Ac 18:21; κατὰ τὸ ἔθος τῆς ἑ., Lk 2:42.†

a summons (as Attic law-term, Dem., al.).; a promise (Dem., Arist., al.): Ac 23:21; esp. in NT of the divine promises, Ac 7:17, Ro 4:14, 16 Ro 9:4, Ga 3:17-18, 21 4:23, He 8:6 11:9, 17, II Pe 3:9; c. inf., He 4:1; γίνεται, etc., c. dat. pers., Ac 2:39, Ro 4:13, Ga 3:16; seq. πρός, Ac 13:32 26:6; έπαγγέλεσθαι τὴν ἐ., I Jn 2:25; ἔχειν ἐπαγγελίας, He 7:6, II Co 7:1; εἷναι νἐ έπαγγελίᾳ, Eph 6:2; ἡ γῆ τῆς ἐ., He 11:9; τὰ τέκνα τῆς ἐ., Ro 9:8, Ga 4:28; τ. πνεῦμα τῆς ἐ. τ. ἅγιον, Eph 1:13; αἱ διαθῆκαι τῆς ἐ., Eph 2:12; ἡ ἐ. τ. θεοῦ, Ro 4:20; pl., II Co 1:20; αἱ ἐ. τ. πατέρων, Ro 15:8; c. gen. obj., τ. ζωῆς (v. Dalman, Words, 103), I Ti 4:8; τ. παρουσίας αὐτοῦ, II Pe 3:4; κατ ̓ ἐπαγγελίαν, Ac 13:23, Ga 3:29, II Ti 1:1; δι ̓ ἐπαγγελίας, Ga 3:18; συμμέτοχα τῆς ἐ., Eph 3:6; λόγος ἐπαγγελίας, Ro 9:9. By meton. (cf. ἐλπίς), of a promised blessing: Lk 24:49, Ac 1:14, Ga 3:22, He 6:12-17 10:36 11:13, 33 11:39; c. gen. epexeg., Ac 2:33 Ga 3:14, He 9:15 (Cremer, 27).†

to announce, proclaim.; (a) to promise; to profess. Mid., also freq. in both these senses; to promise: c. dab. pers., He 6:13; c. acc rei, Ro 4:21, Tit 1:2; c. dat pers. et acc rei, Ja 1:12 2:5, II Pe 2:19; ἐπαγγελίαν, I Jn 2:25; c. inf., Mk 14:11, Ac 7:5; seq. λέγων, He 12:26; ptcp., He 10:23 11:11; to profess: θεοσέβειαν, I Ti 2:10; γνῶσιν, I Ti 6:21. Pass., Ga 3:19 (cf. προ-επαγγέλλω; and v. Cremer, 26).†
a promise: II Pe 1:4 3:13.†
to bring upon: c. dat. et acc, II Pe 2:5; ἑαυτοῖς ἐ. (for cl. mid., v. Mayor, in l), II Pe 2:1; ἐ. τὸ αἷμα (cf. Ge 209), Ac 5:28.†
to contend with (Plut.).; to contend for (C.I., 2335, 19): c. dat. rei, Ju 3.†
to assemble besides (Plut.): pass., Lk 11:29.†
Epænetus, a Christian of Borne: Ro 16:5.†
to praise: c. acc, Ro 15:11, I Co 11:22; seq. ὅτι, Lk 16:8, I Co 11:2; absol., seq. ὅτι, I Co 11:17.†

to lift up, raise: τ. ἀρτέμονα, Ac 27:40; χεῖρας, Lk 24:50, I Ti 2:8; κεφαλάς, Lk 21:28; ὀφθαλμούς, Mt 17:8, Lk 6:20 16:23 18:13, Jo 4:35 6:5 17:1; φωνήν, Lk 11:27, Ac 2:14 14:11 22:22; τ. πτέρναν (fig.), Jo 13:18. Pass., Ac 1:9; metaph., to be lifted up with pride: II Co 10:5 11:20.†
to be ashamed (of): absol., II Ti 1:12; c. acc pers., Mk 8:38, Lk 9:26; c. acc rei, Ro 1:16, II Ti 1:8 1:16; ἐπί, c. dat. rei, Ro 6:21; c. inf., He 2:11; c, acc pers, et inf., He 11:16,†
to ask besides.; to beg (as a mendicant; cf. MM, Exp., xiv): Lk 16:3 18:35 (Cremer, 74).†

to follow after; in NT metaph.; absol.: Mk 16:20 (illustrated by use in verifying accounts; v. MM, Exp., xiv; Milligan; NTD, 78); c. dat. pers., of sins, I Ti 5:24 (cf. Ellic. and CGT, in l); τ. ἴχνεσιν, I Pe 2:21; ἔργῳ ἀγαθῷ, I Ti 5:10.†
to listen to.; to hearken to, hear with favour (one's prayer): c. gen. pers., II Co 6:2 (LXX).†
to listen attentively: Ac 16:25 (cf. Page, in l).†
later form of ἐπήν,; after, when: c. subjc. Pres., Lk 11:34; c. subjc. aor., Mt 2:8, Lk 11:22.†
ἐπάναγκες (sc. ἐστί), it is compulsory, necessary.; As adv., of necessity: Ac 15:28.†
to bring up or back (sc. ναῦς); to put out to sea (DB, iii, 63b): Lk 5:3-4; intrans., to return: Mt 21:18.†
to remind again: c. acc pers., Ro 15:15.†
to refresh, cause to rest (upon); mid., to rest upon: metaph., c. dat., Ro 2:17; seq. ἐπί, c. acc, Lk 10:6 (Cremer, 827).†
to return: Lk 10:35 19:15.†
to raise up against; mid., to rise up against: seq. ἐπί, c. acc pers., Mt 10:21, Mk 13:12.†
correction: of life, II Ti 3:16 (cf. MM, Exp., xiv).†

above; adverbially; of place: Lk 11:44; of number, more than: Mk 14:5, I Co 15:6.; As prep. C. gen.; of place: Mt 2:9 5:14 21:7 23:18-22 27:37 28:2, Lk 4:39 10:19, Re 6:8 20:3; of pre-eminence: Lk 19:17-19, Jo 3:31.†
accursed: Jo 7:49 (for exx. from π., v. MM, Exp., xiv; cf. Cremer, 108).†
to be strong enough for.; to ward off.; to aid, relieve: c. dat. pers., I Ti 5:10 5:16 (mid., WH, mg.).†
the jurisdiction of a prefect, a province: Ac 23:3, 34 25:1.†; *†ἐπάρχεισς, -ον,; of a prefect: ἡ ἐ. (sc. ἐξουσία) = ἐπαρχεια, q.v., Ac 25:1 (WH, mg.).†
a dwelling, habitation: Ac 1:20 (LXX).†
on the morrow: in NT, ἡ ἐ. (sc. ἡμέρα), Mt 27:62, Mk 11:12, Jo 1:29, Ac 10:9, al
Epaphras: Col 1:7 4:12, Phm 23.*†
to foam up: metaph., τ. αἰσχύνας, Ju 13.†
Epaphroditus: Phl 2:5 4:18.†
to rouse up, excite: C. acc rei, διωγμόν, Ac 13:50; ψυχάς, Ac 14:2.†

conj. (ἐπί, εἰ),; when, since; of time, when, after: Lk 7:1 (Rec., WH, mg.).; Of cause, since, because: Mt 18:32 21:46 27:6, Mk 15:42, Lk 1:34, Jo 13:29 19:31, Ac 13:46 (Rec., WH, mg.), I Co 14:12, II Co 11:18 13:3, He 5:2, 11 6:13 9:17 11:11; ἐ. οὖν, He 2:14 4:6. With ellipsis, otherwise, else: Ro 11:6, 22, He 9:26; ἐ. ἄρα, I Co 5:10 7:14; introducing a question, Ro 3:6, I Co 14:16 15:29, He 10:2 (cf. IV Mac 1:33 Mac 2:7 Mac 2:10 Mac 4:24-26).†
conj.; of time, when now, after that: Lk 7:1 (WH, txt.).; Of cause, seeing that, forasmuch as: Lk 11:6, Ac 13:46 (WH, txt., RV) Ac 14:12 15:24, I Co 1:21-22 14:16 15:21, Phl 2:26.†
conj.,; forasmuch as ("a stately compound," freq. in cl. and suitable for the formal introduction of Lk): Lk 1:1.†
with a view to bless: c. inf., Lk 1:25 (cf. DB, 136b).; To punish: seq. ἐπί, Ac 4:29.†

to come upon, approach; Of time, to come on or after; mostly as ptcp., ἐπιών, -οῦσα, όν, next, following: τῇ- ἔ. (sc.ἡμέρᾳ, as freq. in late Gk.), Ac 16:11 20:15 21:18; ἡμέρᾳ (as usual in cl.), Ac 7:26; νυκτί, Ac 23:11.†
conj., since indeed: Ro 3:30 (Rec.; εἴπερ, WH).†
a bringing in besides or in addition (Hipp., FlJ, al.): He 7:19 (cf. MM, Exp., xiv).†
to come in upon: seq. ἐπί Lk 21:35.†

thereupon, thereafter, then: Lk 16:7, Ga 1:21, Ja 4:14; seq. μετὰ τοῦτο, Jo 11:7; μετὰ ἔτη τρία, Ga 1:18; διὰ δεκατεσσάρων ἐτῶν, Ga 2:1; πρῶτον . . . ἔ., I Co 15:46, I Th 4:17, He 7:2; πρότεφον . . . ἔ, He 7:27; ἀπαρχὴ . . . ἔ., I Co 15:23; εἶτα . . . ἔ., I Co 15:5-6 (WH, txt.); . . . ἔ., I Co 15:5-7 (WH, mg.); τρίτον . . . ἔ. (his), I Co 12:28.†
beyond; c. gen., Ac 7:43 (LXX) †
to extend: mid., to stretch forward: c. dat., Phl 3:13.†
an outer tunic (RV, coat): Jo 21:7 .†
= -δύνω (Hdt.),; to put on over; pass. (Plut., al.), to have on over, be clothed upon: II Co 5:2-4.†

to come to, arrive, come on: seq. ἀπό, c. gen. loc., Ac 14:19 (ἐπῆλθαν; cf. M, Pr., 65; Deiss., BS, 191); of time, Eph 2:7.; to come upon (as in Hom.): of calamities, Lk 21:26, Ac 8:24 13:40, Ja 5:1; of an enemy, Lk 11:22; of the Holy Spirit, Lk 1:35, Ac 1:8, [in LXX: γίγνομαι ἐπί, Jg 14:6, III Ki 11:6, al.].†

to in­quire of, consult, question: c. acc pers., Mk 12:34, Lk 2:46, al.; c. dupl. acc, Mk 7:17 11:29, Lk 20:40, al.; c. acc pers., seq. λέγων, Mt 12:18, Mk 9:11; εἰ, Mk 8:23, Lk 23:6, al.; ἐ. θεόν, Ro 10:20 (LXX).; In late Gk., to beg of, demand of: c. acc pers. et inf., Mt 16:1 (cf. ἐρωτάω; and v. Cromer, 716)
a question, au inquiry (Hdt., Thuc.).; a demand: I Pe 3:21 (v. ICC, in l).†

to hold upon.; Like παρέχω (as in Hom., al.), to hold out, offer: λόγον ζωῆς, Phl 2:16.; to hold or direct towards, Sc.νοῦν; absol., to intend, purpose; to observe, give attention to (v. MM, Exp., xiv): seq. πῶς, Lk 14:7; c. dat. pers., Ac 3:5, I Ti 4:16.; to stay, wait: Ac 19:22 (in legal phrase, MM, Exp., l.c.).†
to revile: c. acc pers., Lk 6:28; c. acc rei (but v. ICC, in l), I Pe 3:16.†

with primary sense of superposition, on, upon. C. gen., of place, answering the question, where? of the place on which, on, upon: ἐπὶ (τ.) γῆς, Mt 6:10, 19, al.; τ. κεφαλῆς, I Co 11:10; τ. νεφελῶν, Mt 24:3o, al.; like ἐν, in constr. praegn. after verbs of motion: βάλλειν, Mk 4:26; σπείρειν, ib. 31; ἔρχεσθαι, He 6:7, al.; fig., ἐπ’ ἀληθείας (MM, s.v. ἀ.); of the subject of thought or speech, Ga 3:16; of power or authority, over, πάντων, Ro 9:5: τ. γάζης, Ac 8:27; ἐξουσία, Re 2:26 20:6; of vicinity, at, by: τ. θαλάσσης, Jo 6:9; τ. ὁδοῦ, Mt 21:19; τοῦ βάτου, Mk 12:26 (v. Swete, in l.); c. gen. pers., in the presence of, before, Mt 28:14, Ac 23:30, I Co 6:1, al. Of time, c. gen. pers., in the time of: ἐπὶ Ἐλισαίου, Lk 4:27; ἐπὶ Κλαυδίου, Ac 11:28; ἐπὶ Ἀβιάθαρ ἀρχιερέως, when A. was high priest, Mk 2:26; c. gen. rei, at, at the time of: Mt 1:11, He 1:2, II Pe 3:3; ἐπὶ τ. προσευχῶν, Ro 1:10, Eph 1:16, I Th 1:2, Phm 4. C. dat., of place, answering the question, where? lit., on, upon: Mt 9:16, 14:8, al.; after verbs of motion (v. supr., I, 1, (a)), Mt 9:16 Ac 8:16; above, Lk 23:38; at, by, Mk 13:29, Jo 5:2, Ac 5:9, al.; metaph., upon, on the ground of, Lk 4:4 (LXX); in the matter of, Mk 6:52 (v. Swete, in l.); upon, of, concerning, Ac 5:35, 40; of the ground, reason or motive (Bl., §38, 2; 43, 3), Mt 18:3 19:9, Ro 12:12, al.; ἐφ’ ᾧ, for the reason that, because, Ro 5:12 II Co 5:4; after verbs of motion, over, Mt 18:13, Ro 16:19, al.; of a condition (cl.), Ro 8:20, I Co 9:10; ἐπὶ δυσὶ μάρτυσιν (v. Westc. on He 9:10), He 10:28; of purpose or aim, Eph 2:10, Phl 4:10; of authority, over, Mt 24:47 Lk 12:44; of hostility, c. dat. pers. (cl.), against, Lk 12:52; in addition to (cl.), II Co 7:13; of an adjunct, in, at, on, Phl 1:3 2:17. C. acc., of place of motion upon or over, answering the question, whither? lit., upon, over: Mt 14:28, 29, Lk 5:19, al. mult.; in NT also, answering the question, where? (as c. gen., dat.), Mk 4:38 11:2, Lk 2:25, Jo 1:32; ἐπὶ τ. αὐτό, Ac 1:15 2:1, al.; of motion to a vicinity, to, Mk 16:2, Ac 8:36, al.; metaph. (in wh. "the acc. is more widely prevalent than it strictly should be," Bl., §43, 1); of blessings, evils, etc., coming upon one, c. acc. pers., Mt 10:13 12:28, Ac 2:17, Jo 18:4, Eph 5:6, al.; of addition (dat. in cl.), λύπη ἐπὶ λύπην, Phl 2:27; ἐπικαλεῖν ὄνομα ἐπί (v.s. ἐπικαλέω), Ac 15:17, Ja 2:7; καλεῖν ἐπί, to call after, Lk 1:59; of number or degree: ἐπὶ τρίς (cl. εἰς τ.), thrice, Ac 10:16 11:10; ἐπὶ πλεῖον, the more, further, Ac 4:17 II Ti 2:16 3:9 (v. also infr., 2, (a)); ἐφ’ ὅσον (v. infr., ib.), forasmuch as, Mt 25:40, 45, Ro 11:13; of power, authority, control, Lk 1:33, Ac 7:10 Ro 5:14, He 3:6, al.; of the direction of thoughts and feelings, unto, towards, Lk 1:17 23:28, Ac 9:35, 42, Ro 11:22, Ga 4:9, Eph 2:7, I Ti 5:5, al.; of purpose, for, Mt 3:7, Lk 23:48; ἐφ’ ὅ πάρει (Rec. ἐφ’ ᾧ, Mt 26:50; of hostility, against, Mt 24:7, Mk 3:24-26 10:11 13:8, Lk 9:5, Jo 13:18, Ac 7:54, I Co 7:36, II Co 1:23; Of reference, concerning, for (cl. usually dat.), Mk 9:12 15:24, Jo 19:24, Ro 4:9. Of time, during, for: Lk 4:25 (WH, txt., omits ἐπί), Ac 13:31 16:18, He 11:30, al.; ἐφ’ ὅσον (χρόνον), as long as, for so long time as, Mk 9:15 Ro 7:1, al. (for ἐφ’ ὅ in another sense, v. supr., 1, (b)); ἐφ’ ἱκανόν (v.s. ἱ), Ac 20:11; ἐπὶ πλεῖον (v. supr., 1, (b)), yet longer, further, Ac 20:9 24:4; on, about, towards (cl. εἰς): Lk 10:35 Ac 3:1 4:5.
